The meat servers are always attentive about coming to your table with the meat skewers and ready to give you as many cuts of meat as you like. The staff at the bar is fun and friendly, and the management always stops by your table to ensure you are satisfied and have been taken care of. I would recommend Via Brasil to anyone interested in casual dining, a formal night for a date, or a family affair or event. Regardless of your reason for visiting you will leave well taken care of and happy!

I would have to say one of my favorite places to eat in Las Vegas.  The meats are always cooked on point.  The flavors are there, no sauce needed.

The salad bar and hot apps bar is a great touch.  There is always a coupon available or a deal you can find to save a few dollars.  Go at lunch and it almost half the price.

Many of the buffets around town are approaching $20-$30 per person, why not get real food for that price.

The only reason I give it a 2 star is because of the girl that brought us our food, Not my waiter.. The bus girl that should of been my waitress!!! I got sick from eating here. Diarrhea !!!!!!!! For 8 hours after 
If you want Brazilian steakhouse take the trip to town square.... Bc this one was terrible. I do not suggest this place & hopefully that girl finds a new place to work!!
One of the best Brazil steak joints in the Vegas valley. Everything is good. Tender mean, good waiter service, and a full bar.

Awesome environment! I personally LOVE buffets, but I also love the fine dining industry. Via Brazil was the perfect mix of the two and would have to rank one of my favorite restaurant experiences of 2014! With over 20 different varieties of meat, waiters walk around the restaurant with different selections in hand and gracefully offer to cut off a piece of your likings as many times as you please! There are no menus to make it simple, the salad bar has a great variety of salads, pastas, fruits, cheeses and condiments.  You are given three sides to go with your unlimited fancy of meat, and salad bar choices. So much fun, the employees are great as everyone has a welcoming attitude. If your looking for a new kind of dinning experience, this is the place to be, in the heart of Summerlin!

Nice place. But that's it. If you want to try Brazilian food this is not the place.
They tried, but aside from some of the staff nothing was Brazilian at all. The meat was "slowly" coming toward us and it got cold all the time. With my complaint the "capitāo" that is the nickname of the Chef he then made sure that the meat got to us warmer. The only kind of meat I wanted came just 1 time. Picanha. The only piece of meat that I can say was good was caw ribs. The pork was coming with a weird sauce. Rice ok, beans cold and without any juice. The yuca was undercooked and oily. Salad bar was poor. Again was ok if you don't know the real taste. I hope they can improve. Send the chef to Brazil for a 5 day training camp. Good luck

I am a regular here...well regular as one can be.  I come here about once every six months. That is about enough time to  forget about my last meat hangover and prepare myself  for the next meat hangover.  I always have this dooming feeling that this place is going to shut down, because it was unprofitable due to me and my husband eating atleast 5 lbs of meat, EACH!

Despite being somewhat buffetish, I think the quality remains high and consistent. Frankly, I am very discriminant about what I eat from the "buffet bar", while it show freshness, chose wisely, most of it is just filler and distraction from the more expensive meat.  I do eat the beef or salmon carpaccio and sample the soup and hot appetizers... all decent.  However, a little plate of roughage doesn't hurt and can be a welcoming break from the continuous onslaught of hot sizzling meat coming your way.  The meat and variety is awesome especially if you desire red meats. 

I notice a few cost saving changes that I think make total sense.  The table side, side dishes are smaller portions but still you can order as many as you want and I am pretty sure if you finish and want more,  they will bring you more.  Shrimp cocktail at the buffet is composed of small shrimps, where as before they were large ones.  Now the large shrimp come tableside, which are brushed with a delicious garlic sauce.  I didn't see much of a raw seafood selection anymore. 

Service was "good" this time, but in the dozen and half  times I've been here, I've never had less that good service and more often than not it has been excellent and cordial.

P.S.  read the fine print. if you have the recent Groupon offer, be aware it is more like buy one meal at full price get one half off.   If there are two of you, you cannot use two coupons, but you can use two coupon If you have four people.

Just go and enjoy.

This place is awesome!!! I've been here twice, once with a bachelor party and another time as a group of two couples.  The first time we went all out with the boys and it was amazing, we even had a vegetarian with us and he loved it. The meat was perfect the waiters were attentive and very friendly and best of all the drinks were made perfectly. There side dishes are superb and you should definitely order them. The fried bananas are damn good. 

The second time with the couples I noticed the same staff was still employed. A very good sing in my opinion. The food again was spectacular and we enjoyed our meal with some excellent wine. We have a Brazilian BBQ in Palo Alto, Pampas, but it's more expensive and not nearly as good as Via Brasil. This place is reason enough to go to Vegas.

Oh and it's not overpriced at all. Not for the food and service you receive.

I'm sure everyone wants to compare this place to Texas de Brazil so here it is....

If you like you're meat rare, VIA
If you're really into the awesome salad bar, Texas
If you love lambchops, Texas, VIA does NOT have lambchops...be forewarned 
If you don't want to wait at least 15-30 min every-time you go, VIA

Its a tough choice but if i HAD to chose one, I'd have to go with Texas, a few more selections at the salad bar and Lamb chops trumps all for me
The supreme meat option is awesome. Plenty to eat, lots of variety. The staff was very polite.

Went in for the first time and we were blown away by how delicious and amazing everything was! The decor was so elegant , it felt like we were being very spiked by the servers, the drinks were the best we have ever had. Made us want to go there every weekend! Certainly reccomend for everyone to go any experience it for yiurslevrs, all we had to say was "WOW" the whole time!!! :)

Wow!  What a great meal! The waiter comes to your table with a bread basket with several doughnut hole shaped buns.  They are Brazilian cheese buns dusted with parmesan cheese.  There were excellent!

I started with the salad bar and took items sparingly.  I tried the cold, sliced portabello muchrooms, one tomato caprese, asparagus risotto, two small artichoke heart halves, and two large shrimps and a piece of fish from their hot seafood mixture.  This was the extent of my salad bar foray as I didn't want to fill up on salad.  It would be a great dinner in itself.

I turned the coaster to the green side meaning bring on the meat.  Before they started that, a waiter brought three dishes to the table - one with 3 fried plantains, another with mashed potatoes, and a third with green beans with garlic.  These were my vegetables to go with my meat.  A lot of food to accompany a lot of food.

I didn't try all the meats as I was filling up before they had a chance to bring everything to my table.  I liked the small sausage, the first meat I tasted and it was excellent.  Beautiful seasoning.  Then I had two thin slices of rare prime rib which was excellent also.  I had both the chicken breast wrapped in bacon and the tenderloin wrapped in bacon.  Both were very good.  The seasonings were perfect.  I am a salt user extraordinaire, but I salted nothing except the mashed potatoes and green beans.  I had the garlic picanha (top sirloin) and it was superb!!  I also had one slice of beef rib which is sliced from a rack of rib (large--not baby back) and served on a separate small plate. 

Since there were only two tables occupied in the restaurant, there weren't several guys walking around distributing meat like rodizio restaurants.  Two guys were tasked with the serving.  I didn't get the pork loin and I forgot Tony's mentioning of chicken hearts--damn, damn, damn.  Well, something to look forward to next time.

After all this, I did hold back so I could try some dessert.  I had a slice of peanut butter, chocolate chip cheesecake.  Oh yeah--great!

Service was impecable.  My iced tea was refilled often, staff was always around to answer questions or see if you needed something.  I was greeted at the door by a delightful young lady and she also bid me a kind, smiling farewell!

The place is very nicely done.  I love the wine rack that goes almost to the ceiling.  I could see the super ladder inside to extend and reach the highest shelves.

This is a great deal with a Groupon.  The Groupon was $21.  The regular price for the rodizio is $42.95.  I'm not sure I'd be back for the full price, but the Groupon certainly makes it a great deal.  Come on Groupon--let's get anohter Via Brasil.  And you know, I'll probably go back and pay the full price if one of my friends from out of town who loves rodizio comes to Las Vegas.  We'll go together!

I went here for dinner and the food is good.  My wife and I also had a bottle of Malbec that was tasty with all of the food. 

A pleasant experience all around.

I enjoyed the lamb with mint jelly and the steak.  It is really easy to eat here on a low carb diet and is very tasty.

I don't think there's anything about this place that couldn't be described as a homerun.  Really, great food with great service.  If you come for brunch, I highly suggest the bacon-wrapped filet.  Mmm.

Excellent food and endless meat oh wow!!! My fiancé and I usually go to Texas de Brazil but we decided to try this place since they are a tad bit closer. I'm actually impressed! Place is delicious and the staff are extremely nice! Our drinks are never low and the food is amazing. I also enjoy the fact that their salad bar is gluten free! Amazing! We will definitely come back here again. No more Texas de Brazil for us! Were gonna come here only!

First time at a Brazilian steak house.Sterling dinner for 2! Delicious! Medium rare steak. Mouth watering Shrimp. Filet mignon wrapped in bacon the best . Salmon with lime and pomegranate sauce perfect combination. Will definitely be returning to dine again! Service was excellent.

Service was incredible.  Everyone friendly and with a sense of humor.

The food was amazing.  The meats kept coming and I didn't want to turn the card to red.  I tried about everything they had.  The salad bar and sides were also nice, offering great accompaniments to the meats.

For dessert we had the bananas flambe.  This was the BEST dessert I have ever had anywhere.  Trust me, you HAVE to get this at some point.  The presentation and taste of this is on a different level.

Overall, the people, atmosphere and food make this a place I want to go to again and again.  Also, I am anxious for the brunch which seems great

Two words: Happy hour.

Their food is on-pointe, and with happy hour prices, it doesn't get much better than this.

A word of advice tho: avoid it during the holidays.  Service gets spotty during those times.

First off I will say I love Via Brazil as far as the food quality. I praise Via Brazil to everyone I know saying how great the quality of meat and salad bar drinks and dessert. 
Also, the facility is beautiful but the service is "okay" overall everyone is very nice but I was very disappointed the last time I was there.
On 11/7/14 (Friday night) I made reservations for my a birthday dinner for my boyfriend and his father... I called the day before making the reservation. Lets just say it was a process. I was put on hold for a moment after letting them know I needed to make a reservation, all fine and dandy right? A moment later a woman got on the phone with a very thick accent. As I was giving my information she could hardly understand what I was saying. I had to spell out every word. She started to get frustrated and I could tell so I asked if there was someone else I could talk to, she put me on hold without saying anything and another woman got on the phone. This lady spoke better English and the process sped up. Near the end of the conversation I let the second lady know that it was going to be a birthday celebration and specifically gave her the names of the two men. 
We arrived there early so decided to have a seat at the bar before dinner. The bartender was very nice and told the boys happy birthday after I had mentioned it. (2nd person I told) 
Then we went to our table and the dinner was very good as usual. After dinner they bring around a display of desserts that you can choose from. I thought maybe you have to pick a dessert then they put in a candle or something. I then loudly announced "birthday boys what would you like" as the waiter was standing next to our table. I casually said maybe some cheesecake? The waiter left & we were waiting for the celebration, instead the waiter brought the check which in total we spent over $300 and told us to have a good night...
As you can see there was no birthday celebration, candle, song, or anything of that nature.. VERY DISSAPOINTING.
When we were walking out my boyfriends mother and I approached the front desk person and let them know that we did not receive any birthday dedication and we were sadly disappointed seeing how I specifically made the reservations for this occasion and not to mention spend over 300 dollars!! 
She then said "im sorry, next time"........
Next time?? We did not make a scene or call the manager but I know now not to use this place for celebration. The customer service overall was rough and I thought for a higher end steakhouse we would get some type of acknowledgement.

I have eaten at both Fago de Chao and Texas de Brazil and I think Via Brazil is definitely the best.  All of meats were not as heavy on the salt as the other two places.  Better quality and flavor.  Had a great Christmas Day dinner here.  Service was excellent.  The only slight negative is that the salad bars at the two other places were larger and had a better variety of stuff.  That is the only reason I did not give it five stars.  The items that were on the salad bar at Via Brazil were all very tasty.  I like that the tables at Via Brazil were more spread out and did not seem as crowded and noisy as its competitors.

First, I like this place better than Texas de Brazil.  

Via Brasil has amazing service and warm hospitality.  I have always felt that the energy is very frenzied at Texas de Brazil--they are always very crowded and interested in turning over tables. 

Via Brasil never stopped trying to feed us and constantly made sure our experience was positive.  They pay attention to fine details.  For example, they periodically bring you a clean plate to start over with when you have meat scraps littering your plate.  

The meat quality is excellent and the servers always tell you that if you aren't ready for a meat they have, they will be sure to bring it back around later.  Additionally, one person at my table wanted one last piece of filet at the end, and they fired up a fresh skewer of them, just for him.

We went without a reservation, which was refreshing.

GO to this place!  You won't regret it!

This is actually the first ever Rodizio I have ever tried, and I was really happy with the experience. The service was awesome, and it isn't that pricy for lunch. I didn't try the salad bar because I wanted to leave room in my tummy :) I loved the cheese bread (or whatever it's called) they bring to you when you first sat down; and out of all the different meats, my favorite was the sirloin. Sides taste pretty good too. I think the only thing that bugs me is its location since it's so far from the strip.

In comparison to other brazilian steak houses this place was ok. Ok because the meat kept coming as quickly as i put it my mouth until i said no more. However, the salad bar was lacking in everyway it lacked 90% of what texas de brasil had. period. It sucked to the 10th degree. Whats the deal with ordering the side dishes separately, why not just place it in the salad bar. Its management trying to control cost i believe or trying to make you feel your getting more than usual than other places. Lastly the WAITER was nice but the way they present the way you should eat was shocking. Here is what the head waiter said. i will paraphrase " go ahead and eat the salad bar first and when you done i will bring another plate so you can start eating meat" REALLY SERIOUSly ???U never want to say fill yourself with you pathetic salad bar and when your almost full then you can eat meat. WE WERE AMAZED AT THAT REMARK. I guess it came from management because you never say that to a customer. you should just simply say enjoy the salad bar and start eating all the meat you want. This place is a bit pretentious they should just keep it real and not try to be something better than "the other guys" because it was not.

I went back to Restaurant again ! 
And I had a great time this time (^ ^) 

Even tho I went there last minute last seated / close time .. But stuff never made us feel hurry up or not enough time, not enough food because we came late .. 

We had alooooooooot of food and food was soooooo delicious as usual !!!!

I love all of skewer but I love their shrimp and melt cheese is very special for me cuz I can't get other restaurants these two things ! 

Anyway I still like this restaurant and I wanna go back anytime we want to have a Brazilian big BBQ dinner !!

OK. Now I'm not a big meat fan, however my husband is. First of all, you have to serve yourself at a salad bar. Then they start bringing out all the meat and chicken and lamb and the servers swarm around you all the time, even though you put the stop sign up. Very annoying and not comfortable and the food was just so so and not to mention how expensive it was. Too many other wonderful restaurants to eat at. Will not be going back.

There's already a ton of reviews on here so I will just hit some highlights.  If you want a meat dinner, this is a good choice.  Yes they have a salad bar with a lot of nice items but vegetarians will never get full value out of this place.  With that said, I have been to other Brazilian places in town and this is probably the best.  It looks nice inside and the food quality is quite high.  The price, while "high" in a general sense, is pretty competitive within the Brazilian market.

So why not five stars?  To be sure my last visit was quite recent and quite good.  But, in the past, I have experienced some of the knocks others have noted.  Specifically, waiters that seem to walk right by my table while I sit there, sometimes for a long time, waiting for more meat.  Also - in the past I have also experienced a certain level of "grief" when trying to use a coupon that this place sent me!  If it's a problem, don't send it to me!  

Hopefully these things have been corrected, I did not experience them on my most recent visit I am glad to say, and I probably will be back in time.  I also want to make a special note about the mother/father's day brunch:  Really good and also worth your consideration!

good service, good food, good atmosphere.... happy hour food and drinks are a great deal. I got the vbs filet mignon tournedo. Great meal, perfect combo with the heart of Palm sauce meat was a little over done but good. Calamari was awesome as well as the bacon wrapped shrimp... Karens a great waitress with awesome customer service. Accommodates each customer professionally. Any problems the owner takes care of it quickly and professionally... Will be coming back here soon. Great restaurant.
awesome. good food, great price, fancy fine dinung ambience but not the peice. excellent quality if meats served

I like to consider myself a Brazilian steakhouse junkie! I've been to every Brazilian steakhouse in town on more than one occasion to test out service and selection at different time of the year. Now I went here on a whim with my brother. I figured I have to give it a go even though I was really craving another fine steak Resteraunt. I must say it's definitely not bad. They salad bar has a nice selection, the meats are nicely prepared and the side dishes are suitable. Really the only thing lacking for me was depth of flavor in the meat selection. 
My rating is strictly based on flavor. Texas de Brazil has tastier meats and bananas as well as some sides that are lacking on this menu. But that's just personal preference! 

I definitely would go back and I would take a friend or family member. It's worth a try.
Went for the happy hour. The drinks were great, the food was tasty. Had teriyaki sliders and bacon wrapped shrimp. Service was good

Hmm. I'm conflicted. I likened this restaurant to Texas de Brazil in my head... We went on a Sunday afternoon and there was one other table occupied. The restaurant is clean and the hostess and waiter, both very nice. We started with the salad bar and the selections were "okay". Nothing spectacular, except the asparagus risotto- that was tasty. My picky toddler loved the lobster bisque (she ate free). The meats started coming and maybe because it wasn't so busy it almost seemed like they were trying to get rid of the meat. As for the taste, some were nice while others were tasteless, too salty or very over/under cooked. Maybe we should've spoken up, but at that point- it didn't really matter. For the equivalent price of other establishments that provide the same service, I expected more. There was nothing really wrong... It was just like visiting Olive Garden as opposed to a truly authentic Italian restaurant.

Amazing restaurant with very courteous and attentive workers.  Fidel has been serving us since day one and we've been here a lot after that and he has never changed one bit.  He and his crew are the best as far as customer service is concerned.  Although it's off the strip, this steakhouse is HIGHLY recommended if you're looking for the Brazilian steakhouse experience with better prices and a much larger menu than the others (I'm a local so I know the prices and selections of the other restaurant).  Look for Fidel and you won't regret the drive to get here.  

.::HIGHLY RECOMMENDED::.
Delicious!  My husband I just celebrated our anniversary by having dinner here.  Great food and fantastic service.  The price is on the higher end, but totally worth it!  ENJOY!

After reading the reply from the owner to my review I can clearly see why my experience at her restaurant was so bad. Not only does she not know how to write, but she doesn't know how to run a restaurant. She's also incorrect with her statement that I finished the meat dishes. She came by while I tried to eat the flank steak as I'm sure she could see we were having a hard time chewing it. She offered to bring some ribeye that I never ordered as she said it was more tender. It was more tender but half of it was fat so I couldn't eat that. She ended up charging me for the flank steak that I had to spit out, the ribeye that I didn't order, and the short rib which was disgusting.
Had a great time here.  Food and customer service was outstanding. I have only one suggestion: add some draft beer from the tap.....

I love me some churrascaria. I would like to take a brief break from this review to let you know how much, to the tune of "I Gotta Feelin'":

Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, and Thursday (Do it!) 
Friday, Saturday, Saturday to Sunday, (Do it!) 
Get, get, get, get, get with us you know what we say, say 
Churrascaria every day, churrascaria every day.

Now that I've gotten that out of my system, let's get to the food. I went to this place with my cousin, Paolo D. and we yelped while we were eating. How cool are we? As a result, I have a pretty sweet record of what we ate and how much I liked it. So let's get it started (another BEP reference in 1 review. Score!)

Non-meat items that I thoroughly enjoyed:
- Asparagus risotto - rich, creamy, just wish it spread on the plate more
- Fried bananas were delicious and subtle in their sweetness
- Cheese rolls tasted great when they first came out. 
- Caesar salad was really good just add garlic oregano dressing. I love salad.

On to the main course (aka, things that I love):
- Chicken drumsticks were the first thing I had, really flavorful and I highly recommend them.
- The Seafood in the salad bar was in desperate need of salt. Good thing they have the salt and pepper shaker handy.
- Skirt steak was surprisingly amazing and tender
- Garlic steak was not tender but really flavorful
- Beef Ribs were delightfully fatty and tender
- Parmesan pork was dry but had a nice crust
- Service was very attentive

So this is where I get annoying and nit-picky (not to worry, this is still a 5-star review):
- The "Brazilian Mashed potatoes" were really fluffy. Almost too fluffly. They tasted instant to me, although I am sure they are not. Is it possible that you can make something so well that it gives the impression that it comes out of a box? Possibly.
- I wish they had fruit or something sweet to break up the heaviness of everything. And no, I am not going to pay for dessert after stuffing my face with 20 kinds of meat.
- Salmon was okay but the passion fruit vinaigrette really brought a nice break to the meal
- Bacon wrapped turkey was meh

Overall, I think you should go here.

My husband and I came here awhile ago before a show, I think it was Jubilee, because I had a restaurant.com certificate.  I really have not been happy with the Brazilian meat fest restaurants in this town so far, and I've tried to Texas de Brazil and Pampas, which were both pretty awful.  Via Brasil Steakhouse was not really impressive either, as I had a huge stomach ache after eating here, but not because of filling up so much.  

A lot of the meat was fairly tough and mostly not that flavorful to me.  However I did like the beef ribs, as they were cut off the bone and delicious.  The salad bar is decent, but if you come to a Brazilian steakhouse for the salad, I would go to Texas de Brazil first.  There's more variety for about the same price.

What makes this restaurant stand out however from other Brazilian steakhouses is the immense amount of sides you can order, which are all complimentary.  Normally, you get a few different sides and the rest is at the salad bar.  Here, there's tons including bananas, different vegetables, fries, and other potato fare.  Loved it!

The service is also very good, almost intrusive as they come around constantly to check up on you.

I am extremely upset that I had such a negative experience at this restaurant. 

I will start by saying that the two stars is simply for the food. They have really good food that is really authentic and homestyle Brazilian food which is hard to find in Las Vegas. 

We went to this restaurant a few times in the past few months and have not had the best service which is really a shame. We asked for a table for three. The restaurant was completely empty and had 3 tables seated. The hostess asked us to wait by the door for a few minutes to "see if they had anything available." We were a bit taken back since the entire place was empty, but patiently waited. About 15 minutes went by and the hostess just stood there staring out into space and wouldn't sit us for some reason. 

It was so frustrating that it seemed like they did not want our business. Being that we were so hungry we decided to just leave and drive 30 minutes to Texas de Brazil at Town Square. Totally worth it because they were super happy to help us and their service was phenomenal. 

I promised myself I wouldn't come back to this restaurant because I think customer service is the most important thing for me and this restaurant clearly needs to focus a little less time staring in to space and more time focussing on employee development and training.
Amazing!!!!! If you haven't tried it your missing our big time.....Customer service is out of sight do me a favor try it you won't be disappointed...

I wish there was a negative rating because if there was this place would get it! Worst experience at a Brazilian Steakhouse, ever. My husband paid the extra $$ to get the "best" meat, of which he got none. Our waiter was amenable until my husband started asking where the chicken hearts and Leg of Lamb were, then he was conspicuously absent. After asking three different people for these items the manager showed up. Things went from bad to worse. He proceeded to make inane excuses and argue with my husband as to why the chicken hearts etc were not being served. About this time the "leg of lamb" appeared. Leg of lamb it was not. My husband knows leg of lamb. It got so ridiculous we ask for our check, with still no apology, and proceeded to leave. On the way out I stopped to get the name of the owner so I could complain. I noticed the girl was looking over my shoulder I turned in time to see the manager gesturing to her! He rushed over at this point and told me he was the owner and to take our business elsewhere! No problem $158 down the drain. If this gentleman was the owner I feel sorry for the employees and anyone who dares to venture into this ripoff, sorry excuse for a Brazilian Steakhouse. Would we return? NO!

This is one of my favorite places for happy hour.  Lots of great priced drinks and apps to choose from.  I usually get mojitos or sangria.  They have an outdoor patio which is nice when the weather is nice.  The staff is very attentive.

Came here 01/29/16 had reservation for a party of 7  servers were very polite and professional. food was delicious and satisfying.   decor was nice and upscale . I definitely recommend this place *****

We had our rehearsal dinner here and it was the perfect choice.  Anna did an amazing job coordinating with me and, as I live in Canada, it took a bit of time to get everything organized, but she was always patient and enthusiastic about our dinner.  We had about 30 people and we decided to go with the semi-private room.  The food was awesome and our waiter was on it and had a great attitude having to deal with so many people. In our group we also had a lot of people who had never been to this type of restaurant so it was a fun experience.  Having a buffet style dinner works really well for large groups but unfortunately many buffets are sub-par.  I read other positive reviews of Via Brasil and I must agree the food is awesome and you get value for the price.  Our party was staying at the JW Marriott down the road and Anna was able to organize a shuttle for us as well. Overall a great experience and once back in Las Vegas we will make sure to go again.

Have been coming to Via Brazil for a year now and they haven't disappointed me.  Fridays and Saturdays feature live contemporary jazz during dinner and their Sangria Rojas is a tasty accompaniment to the parade of succulent meats that make their way around the room.  The salad bar/buffet comes with the Rodizio meal(meats and salad bar
) or you can just partake of that alone and everything they serve is delicious.  The service is exceptional and I always feel like a princess when I'm there!  They also feature a happy hour mini Rodizio but iff all you want is to hang out at their awesome bar, the brazilian appetizers are great!

So, my fellow yelpers - 

Both my hubby and I have a tradition - since we both have b-days in September, we usually will just go out to a nice dinner to celebrate "our" days.

Hubby suggested this place, after doing some research, and also hearing the word from co-workers. So in being a yelper, I of course came to yelp to check the overall rating. Then I happened to see the word 'buffet' in the description, and instantly had this nail going down the chalkboard kind of sensation. Stomach kind of lost its appetite a little, and I held my breath about what this meant - but being a good trooper - said nothing and just went along for the ride, figuring I'd at least give it a shot before saying anything.

Soooo, we pull into the plaza where this little gem is hidden, and I was taken back by the very fancy appearance of the building. And from the exterior looking in, I could see a little waterfall feature, so right away my mind was thinking - this is gonna be interesting!

Right upon entering the hostess was very pleasant and very happy to chat it up with my little one in a full blown conversation about her markers! (mind you my little one was the one having to show it off to begin with, but i give kudos to the hostess for entertaining my little one's need for discussing her markers)

Our hostess went and placed us right next to the waterfall, as my daughter kept talking about the waterfall behind the bar too, so we were very happy all around for seating.

Then came the onslaught of attention - really - i mean talk about being pampered little pooches - you name it, there it was! (I have been to some top rated restaurants (names will remain anonymous - not into bashing anyone here), and the service rendered tonight seems to just put some of those other restaurants to shame!!!!) A gal could get used to this kind of pampering for EVERYTHING! Back to the subject - the service. Let's put it this way - short of having a personal massage at the table to throw me into utter 9th heaven, I was well on my way heading there!

For those who have never dined here: you are assigned a table 'captain', whose sole job is to make sure your service is being met for all needs. He will explain to you how things work for the food. You get two cardboard chips, one side says "no meat", the other "more meat". You flip the chip according to wether you want meat or not. If you don't want it - there is the 'salad bar' you can visit, to get your delight of heaven: sauteed mushrooms, grilled portabellos, shrimp ceviche, lobster bisque, varieties of risotto, salad, fine cheeses, bruschetta, beef carpaccio, and a few other items.

Seriously though, service is impeccable. You drain your water cup, it is refilled before you know it (and sometimes without you even realizing it). Drop a napkin, a new one magically appears before you. If you even have a slightest bit of a question on your face, suddenly there is your 'captain' ready to assist you. These guys (and gals) are good! You finish your appetizer, they are ready to help clear your table to bring on your entree. 

If you wish to feast on the meat side - well then just flip your chip to "more meat"! Then comes the never ending (unless you flip your chip) selection of meats! Prime Rib, Turkey, Sausage, Chicken, Lamb, Tri Tip, Sirloin. Here's a great part - you are given at your table setting a pair of tongs (originally thought it was for picking your own bread out of the basket, but nope was wrong), to help grasp the meat they are slicing for you off the oversized kabob sticks! (sorry best way to describe them). The meat is all roasted on large skewers in open flame, which is then brought from table to table, and you are served table side. All I can say is YUUUUUMMY!!!!

Oh and let's NOT forget the sides you can order as well!:

Grilled Asparagus (hate to admit, but these guys were a little on the scrawny side, no where's close to what you would see in the grocery stores) - smeared in  olive oil mixed with garlic. Hmmm. yummy!
Fried Bananas - cinnamon, sugar, and something else all nicely fried up! I recommend this towards your dessert end.
Yucca Fries (pretty tasty! Never had it before, but I liked it!)
There was more for sure, but can't remember them all at this point. My brain is clouded with all the good eats I had!

And juuuust when you think you can't stuff anything else into your bulging tummies - the DESSERT cart winds its way to you upon request! By this point my belly is bulging, my eyes are bulging, my brain is on heavenly overload, and yes I'm getting dessert by golly (special celebrations only come once a year!)!

I dove for the chocolate cake. My daughter picked out the blueberry cheesecake. Neither of us regretted our choices! (ok hubby had no input cuz we felt 2 deserts was best, and our little one was already pining for her blueberries (thanks to Dora the Explorer).) Trust me, YUMMMMMM. Yelp is telling me I'm out of space (NEED MORE SPACE DARNIT!!!) P.S. Kids under 5 are FREE! :)

We were invited for brunch here and like it a lot.  Then we went to try the dinner version and fell in love with the beef ribs.  It's always the Brazilian sausage and beef ribs for me. OMG, I'm in heaven.  If we go back again I'm going straight for the beef ribs.  Nom nom nom.

For three of the four in our party (including my ten and twelve year old) this was our first time at a Brazilian Steakhouse. The servers and hostess and staff went out of their way to make sure we felt comfortable and knew what to expect. The salad bar was incredible! I could have just eaten that and been totally happy...except that the meat was amazeballs! First the salad and starters bar- great selection of veggies, bruschetta, dips, awesome cheeses and olives, pastas, and more. They kept the bar clean and stocked! There were a number of made to order sides too - we tried the asparagus, mushrooms, plantains, broccoli, fries, mashed potatoes and everything was very nicely cooked and seasoned. We ordered a bottle of wine to go with dinner - their selection was large, and the prices ran the gamut from inexpensive to crazy! The meat was, as I mentioned, amazeballs. We tried just about everything, and they were awesome about serving well done meat to my daughter and I and medium well and my son and hubby. Our favorites were Tri tip, New York strip and the lamb. Make sure you try the special of the day. Eight big thumbs up from our family!

Came here for a wedding reception but the food was awesome. Definitely a nice ambiance for the wedding. As far as the food went, the salad bar alone was already awesome. The lobster brusque, the seafood salad, and the chille oil was probably what got me hooked. The clams and the everything else was also worth trying. I didn't want to eat too much of it because I was ready for the meats. 
It's hard to resist food when it's fresh and on a skewer in front of your face.l I tried the bacon wrapped turkey, the prime rib, sirloin steak, pork, the chicken and all of them were tender, juicy, and full of flavor. Definitely worth a trip.
Incredible service. Great salad bar with unusual items. The meat is as tender as can be. Favorite restaurant. Exceptional service from waiters to management.

I moved out here three years ago and made reservations here for our first Valentine's dinner in Las  Vegas. Back then we waited more than an hour past our reservation time. Still not seated, we decided not to wait any longer and ate sushi.  We vowed never to frequent this establishment and we didn't up until this Valentine's day. Guess what?  Same thing happened. I was told I would have to wait an hour from my reserved time. I'm sure the hour would have turned into ninety minutes. We left the restaurant and found another place to dine. To the owner of this place...it's amazing you treat people like cattle by over booking thereby ruining our dinner plans. To those of you that have experienced the same situation, do as i will do, don't ever come here. We have choices of where to spend our money.

This was our first time at Via Brasil.  It will likely be our last.  I understand that they expected to be very busy for Easter Brunch.  However, our reservation is at 12:30, we were seated at 12:35, and we are still waiting to pay the bill. The food quality was okay, not as good as Texas de Brazil in Town Square.  The salad bar left a lot to be desired. The sticking point has been the service, which has been tediously slow, and inconceivably so.  The restaurant had plenty of empty tables for brunch. We finally gave up and set our credit card on the table.  The manager finally picked it up, our server then told us that was a problem with our bill, and proceeded to take another 15 minutes to try to bring us the check.  We ordered a bottle of wine and to brunch menu items. I don't understand how this creates a problem. Via Brasil, you seriously need to work on improving your service.  This was a disappointment for us.
Absolutly amazing food and customer service!!! I highly recommend this place. Steak picana was perfect and the fried bananas were cooked to perfection. High quality food and service. A+

We came here for a paint night/happy hour event.  There was four of us in our group & this was our first and probably last time we will visit this place.  One of our friends ordered the chicken skewer appetizer and it was severely undercooked.  It came out half pink and white with pink juice dripping off the chicken.  Our friend thought the pink juice was from the sauce so she took a bite.  She tried chewing it but she ended up spitting it out cause she said there was something hard in the chicken making it inedible.  So she took another bite but ended up not being able to chew that piece either as she then realized it was still raw.  We flagged down the server who was beyond busy trying to accomodate our entire paint night group of around 40 guests by herself, which was ridiculous.  The server was notified and took the undercooked chicken back and our friend ordered some more bacon wrapped shrimp and fries which were both good but took quite awhile to get as was our drinks.  I ordered a white wine sangria, which was pretty good but took about 20 mins to get.  At the end of our paint night event the server brought us our bills and failed to take off the undercooked chicken skewer.  We brought it to her attention and she said "oh, you wanted that off your bill?"....Uh YES since it was RAW & inedible!  So she said she would check with her manager.  She comes back with another server and let us know that the manager could not take it off since some of it had been eaten.  We all stood there dumb founded and informed her that two bites were taken however both bites had been spit out since they were raw.  Our friend then asks to speak w/ the manager.  The other gal that was w/ our server comes back and informs us that she was able to get the manager "to bend" and was able to get it removed from the bill.  WTF..."to bend" to remove undercooked chicken that was inedible!!!  First off this entire experience was rather poor to begin with.  Clearly they were understaffed and management should know better than to have one server handle almost 40 guests by herself w/ one busser, hence the reason my freaking sangria took 20 mins to bring out.  Additionally the manager should've come out and apologize personally for the undercooked chicken, thats a health hazard & just plain nasty.  And lastly, the servers need to bring out itemized bills to all their guests, as we were all given just the credit card signature receipt only.  I had to ask for an itemized receipt.  Perhaps this business should invest in hiring qualified management instead of cutting corners by inadequately staffing the restaurant during peak times resulting in poor customer experiences.

Service is exceptional. Everyone is so friendly and constantly making sure all of your needs are met. The food is delicious and if there is something you want that they are not bringing around, all you have to do is ask and it will be table side in no time. The options on the salad bar are definitely more then just salad my family enjoyed the clams and the goat cheese stuffed jalapeños. The Parmesan and mozzarella bread they bring before your meal is very good and gluten free since it is made with yucca instead of flour. Must try, highly recommended!
Great Happy Hour.  The flank steak and chimichurri sauce were amazing and the cocktails were great, but dangerous - they went down way too easily.

Super slow service, waiters seemed like we were bothering them whenever we did anything. Told us they'd honor our coupon when we arrived, at the end of the meal told us the coupon was no good. I can get more meat, less salty, at another steakhouse.

First time diners here.  Food is amazing.  I've lived in Vegas for five years and they have the best prime rib I've ever eaten in 30 years.  Super fast on checking up on you and free refills on soft drinks.  I will be back again after I take a food nap.

Amazing, simply amazing!  Worth the price and the drive.  The salad bar is filled with great selections, and the meat is prepared to perfection, no matter how well done you desire it.  Service was very attentive, and came to the table frequently.  A great place to go for a quality meal to celebrate, or take a date, or even just have a nice personal dinner.  

So tonight I was looking at Brazilian Steakhouses on Yelp, and another reviewer mentioned this place.  I live on the other side of the valley, so I was a little hesitant to make the 30 minute drive when I have a couple of places on my side of town.  Well as soon as I took my first bites, I knew it was worth the drive.

The salad bar had a few different dishes in addition to the standard Brazilian Steakhouse fare.  That being said, after a quick trip around it, I didn't grab much, after all, I'm here for the meats.  

As soon as I sat down from the salad bar trip, I was greeted by the gauchos who brought me several kinds of steak, pork shoulder, and turkey wrapped in bacon.  While I like my meat more on the well done side, there were cuts for every preference.  Once I made it known to the gauchos that I liked the meat more well done, every time they approached my table they offered me the well done portions.  

My server was constantly present refilling my beverage and asking if he could get me side dishes,  Unlike the other places I've visited, here you have to request your sides, but they're included in the price.  They have several options and of course they're all unlimited.  

As it said on their menu there are a couple of things you have to ask for, if you would like to have them, including chicken hearts.  From the first trip I took to a Brazilian Steakhouse, I learned to like the chicken hearts, so I made sure to request them.  When they came, they were plentiful and flavorful.  

The only suggestion I have is for them to leave a menu or list of the meats so you know which ones are upcoming, and when to not fill up.  

The atmosphere was great, the gauchos and servers were very attentive, and most importantly the food was flavorful and delicious.  Well worth the cost, and the drive from anywhere in the Vegas Valley.  

With the prices and the drive it is unlikely this is a weekly destination, but I'll definitely be back for special occasions.  It's also a great place to come when you just feel like celebrating a Wednesday night off (or whatever night you feel.)
Been here a ton of times, wether it be for parties, birthdays, work events etc. I love this place! It's great and recommended for anyone with a need for steak! Hah!

This review is for the happy hour only.

Happy hour is 5-8pm daily (on the patio, or at the bar), and it is pretty awesome.  There is a very good selection of appetizers for $5-6, and a lot of them are very, very tasty.  I've tried the sliders, empanadas, asparagus risotto, and beef carpaccio.  Everything was great, and  I can't wait to go back to try everything else.  The salads look delicious.
The $5-6 drink specials are great too.  They offer mojitos (classic, or muddled with fruit), and also caipirinhas.  The caipirinha is a pretty strong drink made with lime juice, sugar, and an alcohol made from sugar cane juice (tastes kind of like light rum).  You also have the option of having this with muddled fruit.  It's great with kiwi, and extra lime.
They do get really busy, so service can be a little slow.

Bring your appetite!

I got a coupon from Groupon so I took my son for two of their all you can eat dinners. I'm sure they have more dining options but I can't speak to them. The decor is classy but not stuffy. Overall I'd say its comfortable with a touch of elegance.

We were seated, given a quick once over on the way to dine (the stop/go button), the salad bar, the free sides, etc. From there we grabbed plates and dove into the salad bar. 

This isn't the usual buffet salad bar, not by a long shot. The quality of everything there stood out. I highly recommend loading up a separate plate with their grilled portobello mushrooms. These go so well with the meats to come that you'll want to have a plate there as a side.

Back at the table, the meat on a skweres started to arrive. They had salmon, beef ribs, top sirloin, skirt steak, lamb and I'm sure I'm missing one other. Different parts of each skewer were cooked to different temperatures so if you preferred medium rare and someone else at the table likes medium well, they can accomodate this without a problem. 

All of the meats were excellend but for me the best by far is the skirt steak. Be sure to save room feel free to request it, they go out of their way to be accomodating.

The only minor criticism is that my son felt the meats were a bit on the salty side. I didn't notice this but he's always been more sensitive than I to salt. 

Overall, highly recommended. At $45 it may be a bit pricy but if your a dedicated carnivor with a good appetite, you'll be glad you went.

Went here for our monthly visit and for Mother's Day. As always the food was great. The service was over the top. Fidel was on top of his game today making sure we had everything we needed before we needed it. Great job. Anna was as friendly as always. Hands down the best Brazilian steakhouse in Las Vegas.

For reference I've been to Fogo de Chao (Vegas and San Diego) and Rei del Gado (San Diego).

I enjoy this place for their food and service.  I love the wide open setting of dinning and huge, huge TV in the center.  The hosts were very welcoming and accommodating by asking us if we wanted more plates or what meats we were wanting.  Hey, and with sooo much meat in my system they know to keep my water filled so I don't dehydrate from all the salt intake.

As for the meats, I was lucky enough to sit near the kitchen and had first cuts right off the skewers!  I kept going back for garlic steak, prime rib and the house special.  Can't really go wrong with the other meats.  I was also slightly surprised that the flan for dessert was of very high quality.  Not too sweet and not that crappy bready texture some flans end up being.

An all around great dining experience from service to food to decor.

Went to eat here a few days ago with some friends. Really enjoyed my time here.  The staff was very friendly and always there when you needed them.  

The salad bar did not have as many options at other Brazilian steakhouses I have visited before but they did have new options.  I loved the asparagus risotto the most.
The meats are great and they also offer a side menu that includes, mashed potatoes, fried bananas, onion rings, asparagus, etc. 

I will be coming back here in the future.

Excellent service, great salads, great meat, 
will definitely visit again. Vinny was a wonderful waiter, Anna a perfect hostess!

They only get 2 stars because the owner needs to learn some serious people skills! I have eaten there twice, the first time was on a week night and there were only about 8 tables seated. Everyone bent over backwards for us, which I expected because they had the time to do it. We liked it so much that we decided to book their New Year's Eve Party. We were 5 minutes late to our 10:30pm reservation and then stood for almost 10 minutes waiting to check in because a large party was standing in the entryway. The hostess (turned out to be the owner) saw us standing there and ignored us. When we finally got to check in she told us that they had given our table away so we now had to wait. After waiting 10 minutes I asked how much longer it was going to be because we had been told the food service stopped at midnight. I couldn't understand her answer because the DJ music was so loud. When I told her this she started screaming at me that I could stop yelling at her and that if we didn't like it we could walk out because she didn't need people like us. When I tried to explain that I was speaking loudly because of the music she cut me off and screamed at me some more. The other hostesses and guests were in shock. So I decided to ask her name. Her answer was that she was the owner and I could call her the owner or I could get out. Since there were no other options for dinner at that point I asked how long it was going to be and she said she had to find somewhere to "put us". We were finally seated last after she seated 6 groups that came in after us. We reached our table at 11:05 and then sat for another 5 minutes before anyone came to the table. There were at least 5 open tables in the section we were in so it was pretty clear there shouldn't have been a problem "finding somewhere to put us". The hostess who did seat us apologized repeatedly for her behavior and said she was sorry there was nothing she could do. It was clear from our conversation with her and other staff during the night that outbursts like this are a regular occurrence and the staff are used to trying to make it up to guests who do stay and eat. I guess it should have been a warning when I saw her grabbing party favors out of a guest's hand and yelling at the woman that she could only have 1 item per person. 
Our server was wonderful once he realized we were his table. However it was clear the staff bringing the meat around had no idea how to navigate a full restaurant. My plate was constantly empty and we spent half the night craning our necks trying to find the closest meat server. The salad bar was the usual which surprised me for a party that they were charging so much extra for. It is tiny compared to other Brazilian Steakhouses we have been to and both times they have hit a big pet peeve of mine. They put the salad dressing in front of the tray of salad so lettuce drops into it during the night. By the time we got to the salad bar the dressing was full of lettuce, which is a health code violation. It has happened both times we have eaten there, so it is clearly not something they care to keep neat. The meats were so salty that I had to ask for center cuts. And after being promised they were serving food until 1am, they stopped bringing meat around at midnight. They put out a dessert buffet at midnight. By 12:20 there were about 20 items left and they were all stale like they had sat out all day before being served. The worse part was they didn't have any more so several people didn't even get dessert which was included in the higher price for the party. We finally had to ask for more fried bananas. Once the server realized we hadn't gotten any dessert he brought us something from their regular menu. 
The last thing that bothered me was on the check. The check had been rung up under a different server's name. When I asked about it we were told that our server was the "second" on a team and the name was the "leader" of the team. I asked where the leader was, and was told she had already left the floor for the night. I thought it was tacky that I was expected to tip a "team" of servers when only one person had spoken to us all night. I am not talking about leaving the bussers and such out. I don't think someone who never even spoke to me should get a tip from me. Especially someone who has already gone home even though we are still seated. 
We won't be going back unless someone else is buying for certain. If you do go, make sure it is on a slow night so you get good service and pray you don't cross paths with the owner.

My husband made a reservation for the family on Friday night for 7:30.  We had a groupon and wanted to use it, so that was the biggest incentive, plus payday meant I had money to spend.  The long week at work also meant I was ready to relax and eat good food.
Walked in and our table was ready.  The service was amazing!  Since it was our first time, we had to learn a little about the process.  Everyone was very attentive to us all.  We got clean plates every so often, and water was refilled before it ran out.
The food was delicious.  My 3 year old could not get enough.  The salad bar had risotto, salad, seafood, mushrooms, rice, and other inviting items.  There were also side dishes you could order.  We got fries for the kids, and asparagus and collard greens for hubby and I.  Then came the meat!  When I turned my card over to green, the servings came nonstop!  There was skirt steak, top sirloin, pork rib, beef rib, prime rib, bacon wrapped turkey, bacon wrapped beef tenderloin, pork tenderloin, chicken legs, frog legs, my  favorite corn, and I don't remember what else.  By the end of dinner, my 3 year old kept asking for more steak!  They brought some out just for him.  For dessert, we had the creme brulee.  It was a huge portion that all of us could share.  It was nice and creamy, not to sweet and was a nice finish to a fantastic dinner.
For all four of us, our bill with the groupon came out to 73 and change.  I tipped 20.  The pricing is great especially since the kids are free.  I definitely think it is worth the money.  If you want to go to Via Brasil, but are on the fence or think that it is a lot to spend, I would say GO GO GO.

I wish I could give this place less than 1 star.  What a horrible experience!

I was part of a larger group and although our experience was bad, we didn't bother asking for a manager because when the couple next to us politely did so, the manager came to the table and was VERY rude to them.  She even went so far as to use racial slurs and call the lady the "C" word!!!  After that, the manager followed the customers to the front door where she continued to harass them.

It's bad enough when your food service sucks but to treat any customer that way is inexcusable.

Not a chance on earth we will ever return to this God awful place.
arguably the best Brazilian in LV, fogo de chao ain't got nothing on these guys. my favorite place in las vegas

Extremely disappointed with this place after our visit last Sunday for my grandmothers 75th birthday. There were 7 of us and we all ordered the Sterling dinner which is $49.99 per person. The Sterling, which is the more expensive choice, offers 21 meats including bacon wrapped filet, porterhouse, lamb, strip steak, etc. All the meat you can want plus unlimited sides and salad bar, sounds good right? WRONG! 

I'll start off with the salad bar. It was very tiny compared to its competitors. There was a small section of lettuce and toppers to make your own salad, some specialty cold cuts and cheeses, a few hot items and some cold salads. Blah. Nothing stood out, but obviously the salad bar is just a filler. Skip this if at all possible. 

The sides. They have a good selection, but again nothing really stood out and these are also fillers. We got the steak fries, which are not the thick fries they are actually skinny so I don't know why they call them steak fries, fried banana, mashed potatoes, yucca fries and sautéed mushrooms. All served with your meal, and unlimited.  

The "rodzio" style dinner left something to be desired. As I said we all got the Sterling dinner. Of the 21 meats on the menu, we may have tried 15 and that's because they did not offer the others. We were offered shrimp, garlic bread, and flank steak a ton of times, yet the expensive meats such as the filet were offered sparingly. When they finally brought the filet to the table everyone opted for some. It was wrapped in bacon which was hardly cooked, so it made the filet chewy and overly salty. Most took the bacon off. When they came around again we asked if they could make the filet without bacon, and they said sure and it would be 10 minutes. No problem. I am not joking when I say we did not get the filet for a good 40 minutes even after we talked to a manager who said she would get it out to us asap. She did mention that the filet had been offered to our table 3 times, which is interesting that they keep track of that. I guess to throw it back in your face when you complain? I'm sorry.. Is $50 a person not enough to warrant more than 3 trips to our table with the prime meats? Disgusting. 

Side note the place was not busy at all, we went Sunday night at 5:30 and there were maybe 8-10 tables so I am not sure what the deal was. Most of the meats we did get were good. I enjoyed the top sirloin and the filet without bacon. I can't look past the bad service and the fact we weren't offered all the meats that we paid for. Looking at their menu now, I never saw the lamb shank, pork ribs, tangy chicken, salmon, or Brazilian pork. They sat us at a big round table at the back of the restaurant in the corner, I kinda feel like we were just shoved off to the side and ignored. Oh and another thing is be prepared to eat in the dark. They have the lights down so low, you can't even tell which meat is which and what your eating. Super annoying. I get wanting to have ambiance, but they go a little too far. 

And finally the icing on the cake is that we told them it was grandma's birthday and wanted to get her a piece of cheesecake, her favorite dessert, and they brought caramel flan. What the hell! She doesn't even like flan. It's like they didn't care to accommodate any of our requests at all. We were paying for the dessert, although it should have been comped after spending $350, but they still couldn't get it right. Extremely, extremely disappointing. After expressing our concerns to the manager she did take $10 off everyone's dinner, which is the only why I gave them a star. But that won't save them. Texas DE Brazil from here on out. I'll never step foot in this place again.
Took some friends visiting from California and it couldn't of been any better. The food and service was unbelievable. Very Very clean and Great atmosphere.

Branch is just good, good price and nice selection of food and salad's
The servers are the Best and very friendly

The meat selection is amazing!  The table side rib eye was so tender! The shrimp was soooo good.  The bacon wrapped filet was tender and very flavorful!  The red sangria was also good. Our only complaint is the coffee.  It tasted like instant.  Extremely strong and as soon as It started to cool down it was sooooo bitter.  I understand most people are not ordering coffee so why not have one of those single cup machines.  The only other thing was they had fried rice to go with black beans.  A nice white rice would have been so much better.  Our server was Vinny and he was amazing.  He was very attentive and took his time with us. We have been to another Brazilian steakhouse on the strip and Via Brazil kicked their butt with the food and service.  We will most definitely be back!

One of my favorite and best priced Summerlin Happy Hours -5 PM to 8 PM in the bar and patio area

They recently expanded their small plate offerings in addition to being able to get their meats by the ounce.

Love their fresh fruit Mojito's and Caipirinha's; and order a different one each time I go.

And as always, exceptional service and libation mastery by Coleen.

The selection of meats, and fish was very good. I especially enjoyed the prime rib, and filet mignon wrapped in bacon.  I truly felt the service was average compared to other Brazilian steakhouses that I have visited. Lastly, the one big advantage for the competition was a much greater selection at the salad bar.

This review stems from sampling their food from Bite of Las Vegas so take it for what it's worth.
We ordered the filet, shrimp wrapped in bacon, & fries. The filet was tender, fresh, & delicious! Anything wrapped in bacon is good, but the shrimp wrapped in bacon was AMAZING & it came on a small bed of rice w/ a simple sauce. The fries were ok & a bit greasy. This was our first time trying food here so we didn't see if it was being made fresh or not, but it tasted as if it was fresh & not sitting like other booths.
If it tasted this good there, I can hardly wait to go eat at this place in person to get a full sense of the food & atmosphere. Def a place to check out for the food!

Great atmosphere. The food is amazing and service even better. I have recommended Via Brasil to several friends, all have said the steakhouse is a classy place to enjoy a nice dinner. The sides and portions are plentiful and have signature taste. The blackened filet mignon absolutely wonderful. I loved every bite and have been back many times and ordered the same sides with dinner. We found our place. Great buffet!

Horrible experience!  Starting with the waiter requiring a credit card to be held "hostage" for each party that wanted separate checks even if we planned to pay cash..  There were 8 people in my party for happy hour.   I have been to this restaurant several times for Happy Hour in the 3 years I have lived in Las Vegas.  They have recently advertised their restaurant quite aggressively.  I will not (nor will the other people in my group) be going back again.  After sitting there for almost an hour and repeatedly asking waiter for a drink (even water would have been nice), we finally got our drinks.  I ordered a Corona with lime and was brought a Stella something or other...not what I ordered.  Others ordered wine and were served something  other than what they ordered. The food orders were all mixed up. Some people got their food right away and were finished eating before others even received their food. Then when we tried to pay our tabs and leave, the waiter brought the wrong credit card to the person asking for hers (scary!)  We asked for the manager who took 30 minutes to come to the table.  We were trying to explain our frustration, but she was looking over our heads at the table next to ours because they were complaining to the waiter as well.  She never once tried to make things right.  I asked for my credit card and my check.  She said she had to run my credit card first.  I told her I never I intended to use my credit card for payment, that I was paying cash, and that the waiter was holding my credit card "hostage".  All in all, it was a terrible experience and neither I nor my friends will be back to this restaurant.

My new husband and I had our wedding reception here and we were not disappointed! We worked with Anna who is fantastic. She talked us through everything we could possibly need, had amazing ideas and was always available if I had questions. The food is incredible! Every wedding guest said they loved it and told us it was way better than doing a generic buffet style. We were able to use the private and semi private areas. Anna and her hostess set everything up gorgeously. We had a small reception of only 50 and Via Brazil was perfect for us. The price was just right too! We got a lot of bang for our buck! Thank you Anna and the rest of the staff for making our night perfect!

What can I not gush about this place, 5 Star all the way! The food is delicious and plentiful. Every time I have been there I have never waited more than 5 minutes for a meat dish to come by the table. The wait staff is very professional and attentive. I never went without a refill of ice tea, even when the place was packed and jamming.

If you are worried about price they also have a locals night on Thursday and lunch on Sunday with discounted rates. Even at full price it is worth it. Bonus kids 5 and under are free.

If you want to get snu snu later in the evening, then take your date here.

This is my favorite spot to take my family or employess here for steak. We had the 50 dollars deals.
Service - 5 stars. Drinks were served and refilled properly. Managers came to ask us for specific items we want and ensure they come out quickly. We did not have to wait. Plates were replaced often since there are more than 16 kinds of meats to enjoy.
Food - 5 stars. The steaks beats Sls, Lawrys many expensive steak houses on the strip and in the casinos such as Bellagio, Encore, Aria. I prefer this place over Texas the Brazil due to their very selective salad bar. You have to try the beef capaccio and many other items from the salad bar. Other steaks worth trying like NY, Tritip, Garlic steak, etc... they all come juicy, hot and delicious. I will never go to a regular steak house ever since their steaks will get cold half way due to the large steaks they serve. This is the inherent advantage of brazilian steak house.
Ambience - 5 stars. It is cozy and family oriented. It is not a bar. We always feel very welcome here. This is our 5th time in 3 months.

All you can eat...say what?

Since my boyfriend and I wanted to go on a fancy date we decided to give this place a shot since we did try Texas De Brazil and liked that place. Most of the people I have talked to about Via Brasil said it was way better, so why not try it.

Salad bar:
They had lobster bisque soup, white rice, salad, sauteed mushrooms, and yummy delicious items to choose from. (Beware: as tempting as it is don't go over board because you want to leave room in your tummy for some meat)

For all you meat lovers they have many different types of meats to eat. The Prime Rib and top sirloin was my favorite. Also, they do have Salmon, which I enjoyed. You also get to choose 3 sides to eat with your meat...we ordered the grilled asparagus, broccoli, and fried plantains. 

I would totally recommend this place! The staff was very friendly and the food was delicious!

My friends and I went to Via Brazil a couple of weeks ago and enjoyed ourselves tremendously.   We are from out of town and had heard from local friends that this was a good place to go.  I wasn't too sure because I had this idea that this was a place that was all meat, and I was not disappointed, IT IS!!  I love, love, love vegetables, pastas, salads, and also meat, but this comes when I feel like it.  I looked at their menu online and thought "it might not be so bad" after I saw some of their salad bar selection.
I made reservations for all of us, and AM I GLAD WE WENT!  
I absolutely loved all of their selections.  Some of us picked the salad bar and some had the Via Brazil  Rodizio dinner.  I absolutely loved their sauteed  spinach side, as well as their broccoli, asparagus, and mushrooms.  Did not need to make room for dessert since their fried banana was the BEST EVER I have ever had.  Since it was some of us ladies birthdays we also got some flan and have to admit it was sooo good (as good as mine) and that is saying something for me!  Looking forward to going back and trying the meats next time!!!  Love the staff too!  They were very attentive to us as well as the rest of the tables  and the restaurant was full.  They were on top of everything!  Would definitely recommend Via Brazil!

The fact that I have experienced another AYCE type brazilian steakhouse the weekend before at Pampas in the Bay Area, unfortunately made me realize that this place was not all that great.  The quality of meat was just OK, and the taste was not too flavorful as I would have imagined it to be. 

The service though was good.  They were courteous, and quick to serve the meat.  But, it took an hour and a half before any salmon came out.  The skirt steak was too thick, and I like it better a little crispy on the outside.  The ribs were good, but the top sirloin was kind of flavor-less.  The bacon wrapped turkey and bacon wrapped tenderloin was good of course because anything wrapped in bacon is good. LOL.

I had to use the typical A1 steak house with a little bit of tabasco to add some flavor and spice.  The salad bar was just OK too.  I enjoyed the portobello mushrooms, and seafood.  But other than that, the salad bar was just OK.  

Overall experiences was just OK.  Fancy place, romantic atmosphere, great two person band, but the food did not impress me much.  

The cappacino and tiramisu helped to replace the flavorless-ness of the food.  

Unfortunately, I cannot really recommend this place.  Sorry.

2.2 stars.  Sorry, but no.  Excellent service of low quality, way over-salted food.  Salad bar had three kinds of lettuce but a very strange selection of other items.  I was trying to figure out just how to make a regular ol' salad with baby gerkins, radishes, and lettuce...is that a salad?  Not to me.  There weren't even any onions!  There were quite a few flies though.  Several were buzzing around the salad bar.  A few visited us over at our table, too.  Salmon and clams were very fishy smelling.  Even after drenching my seafood in lemon, I couldn't eat more than one bite of each due to the overwhelming fishiness.  
I feel bad fo the staff here.  They are trying very hard at this labor intensive set-up.  It's not their fault they have to serve such horrid crap but they do it with a smile.  $40 per person on this low quality for the Prime Rodizio is WAY over the top.  If they had more volume, they'd be able to turn the quality up and the price down.
I had a $15 gift card that I got in the mail, so we tried it.  Not worth it, even with the discount.  I am a foodie and regularly spend anywhere from $20-$200 per meal with no alcohol.  I can aslo handle McDonalds.  I could not handle Via Brasil.  I got a severe headache the next day, rare for me, which I believe is from the abundace of salt that I ate at Via Brasil.  Fortunatley, it went away after I guzzled lots of water.
I won't be able to go back to Via Brasil and I cannot recommend it.
Dinner has killer salmon with passion fruit sauce and seasoned grilled corn. So damn good.
Horrible meat. It's brown not pink. It has zero flavor.  If you go to Texas de Brazil then here you will be super disappointed.

My experience is always great here. It is my favorite for brunch, the different flavored mimosas are great!! The guys are very attentive. I like it more than Texas de Brazil. I've been here for regular dinner as well, and I really can't complain. A+

Been going to this place since 2010 and amazed with how consistent it's been over the years and how it still has the amazing friendly staff. Great food and salad bar. Every time I go they know exactly what my order is and I don't have to say anything.

So gave it another try after being invited back after the bad experience last time. It was pretty much like night and day compared to the last time. It was not nearly as busy as last time so I kind of get the feeling that holidays and special occasions are not the best times to visit. Had Gerardo as a server again ( see previous review) and again he was great. Went above and beyond to get a dish to us that was not being offered on the salad bar but had it specially prepared. Meat selection seemed to be much more than before. This visit we had the choice of sides which I liked much better. 

So overall I either came on a bad night the first time, or special occasion nights are too much for them to handle. I still prefer Texas de Brazil given the choice. That being said I had a much more enjoyable meal this time around and very much appreciate them reaching out to me and recognizing a bad customer experience and making it right.

This place is our favorite "go to" place when it comes to deeeelicious Brazilian style steakhouse meats. By far we've noticed compared to other places in Vegas that here the meat is better and the items offered on the side and at the salad bar are a lot better than other places. Each time we've been the service has been great and the servers are there to overfill you with all the meats they have to offer. We will definitely be returning sometime soon in the very near future I'm sure. Besides its away from all the hustle and bustle on or near the strip, very very nice atmosphere, no doubt.

This place is so much better than Fogo De Choa.  The meats were tasty and not dry.  They even had garlic shrimp.  I usually don't eat chicken but it was so juicy here I had a few pieces.  I will definitely be back.

Had dinner at via Brazil steakhouse, first time there. Impressed with nice spread and variety on salad bar so much that we decided to skip the roaming waiters with their luscious cuts of meat, poultry and fish. Will have to come back for that part of the menu!  The service was excellent, very friendly and accommodating servers! They also have a great cocktail bar setting and a Sunday brunch that is well worth the small price!!

Like most Brazilian steakhouses, Via Brasil features an elegant dining room with excellent service. I usually skimp over the salad bar, but the appetizers were really good. The spread had the perfect mix of charcuterie, salad, and vegetables. I enjoyed the crab ceviche, beef carpaccio, and the various assorted grilled items. But, in all seriousness, I was here for the meat, not the salad bar. 

Via Brasil jumps to the top of my list for one of the best Brazilian steakhouses for their meats. I loved that the skin of the chicken drumsticks were perfectly crispy. All of the beef (top sirloin, tri-tip) was perfectly medium-rare. One of my biggest gripes about Brazilian barbecue is how salty all their roasts are, but I found all the meats to be well-seasoned without being over-seasoned, especially the crusts. The flavors were amazing. Also, baked cheese? Love it! The cheese paired wonderfully with the meats. 

What didn't I like? The rotation of meats didn't come frequently enough and at one point we were at a standstill. There were no ribs, lamb, or fish offered that evening. The other disappointment was the cheesecake for dessert. They actually ran out and I got one of the last slices, but it was far from what they labeled "NY cheesecake." It was heavy and generic. I should've gone for the Brazilian doughnuts with ice cream. 

I'll end with a positive note. The tableside basket of cheese-baked bread balls were simply amazing. Single-most addictive item on the menu.

Amazing!  Be prepare to eat. The host was great he explain how the dinning experience works.  Staff will come around with different type of meat and you can select what you want. Expensive but worth it.

Via Brazil is hands down one of the best restaurants in Las Vegas!!! Our server Fidel and the manager were 5 star quality. The meats were perfect and the appetizers were worth every bite. Help support a locally owned diamond of a restaurant. My wife and I come a few times a year and have never been disappointed.

Went for brunch today. Super disappointed in the salad bar. I guess I had high expectations going in because I was expecting something similar to Texas de Brazil. It was much smaller and nothing tastes great. The best part was the bottomless mimosas and bloody Mary's. The meat was okay nothing to fav over my favorite would have to be the garlic steak. Had a few issues checking out. But other than that it was okay. Don't think we will be back but that's only because I know we can get a better selection of food at the same price else where.

Came here for dinner. The service was awesome! Everyone was really attentive and helpful. You get a card to signal when you want food or not and when you flip it to green, someone comes right away to bring you food. The gourmet salad bar was great, the meat was good, and they have a good dessert selection. I had a big serving of creme brulee. Ill definitely come back! Make sure you go on an empty stomach!
