I couldn't believe this place 
First it all they are watching you all the time to see if you share a little piece of beef with  my daughter . Can you believe it???? Lol
Suddenly I saw a guy behind me saying we cant share lol are u kidding me 
Do not waste your money coming to this place 
Go to Texas de Brazil which is better and cheaper

My hubby has a birthday coming up and he wants Texas de Brazil for his special dinner. Since we had been to TDB before, and not tried Via Brasil even though it is in our area, I figured we could give it a shot. I did have an A-OK experience, but I am glad it wasn't his actual birthday dinner or I would have been disappointed we didn't go to TDB. 

The "Rodizio" dinner is priced at $45.99 per person. A 50 plus item salad bar is included, and you get to try 18 different meats that meat carvers bring to your table on skewers. You can choose if you want what they have and how much. If pink meat isn't your thing, you can request any of the meat be cooked to to your liking. They give each person there own round paper disc that you turn to green when you are ready for more meat and then you turn it to red until you are ready for more or are simply done eating. I was impressed by the fact that the side dishes were included with the meal. They had like 16 to choose from and you can pick as many as you like. That is a nice touch! They ask that you tell them your sides when you first get there so they can start preparing them. 

So I am not a vegetarian at all, but I don't eat a whole lot of meat. Tonight was my night to shine as the carnivore I am not. I absolutely succeeded! I first went to the salad bar. I wasn't impressed. There were a lot a seafood options which is great, but not for someone like me who doesn't eat seafood. I didn't feel there was a lot of options for a salad however the veggies they did offer were fresh and delicious. I put some "Caprese Salad" on my plate and that was actually very good. As we finished up our salad, the sides we ordered arrived. The "White Rice" paired nicely with the "Sauteed Mushrooms" and the "Fried Banana" was good. Then the meats started coming! I have to admit that the "Top Sirloin" known as "Pichana" that they claim is the star of the meal was not good at all. The meat was tough and flavorless. The "NY Strip", and "Prime Rib" were the same, tough meat and flavorless. Then came the "Bacon Wrapped Turkey" and THAT is delicious. I'm a huge fan of bacon and the bacon really added a nice flavor to the turkey. Then came the "Garlic Filet and "Bacon Wrapped Filet and these two are the star of the meal to me. The filet was so tender and flavorful. I like my meat cooked well done so the server took note of that and made sure to bring me pieces with no pink. I liked my meal, but can't see coming back and paying full price again. Maybe if it were a deal they had going on or something. The meat at first was not good, and the salad bar was not great. I know this isn't TDB, but I do have to compare it because they both have the "churrascaria" thing going on. And the salad bar at TDB is worth just eating that alone. The sides were decent, but I only enjoyed a few types of the meat so I'd rather spend the extra to have TDB. 

There is a Happy Hour here at Via Brasil Monday - Sunday from 5-8 pm in the patio/bar. Every Sunday they have a "Sunday Brunch" from 10 am - 2 pm and have different specials for the brunch so you might want to call and ask if there is a theme for that day. They have several options for events and banquets too.

Pretty good off-strip buffet.  We went here on our way to the red rock mountains (not casino).  In sum, it wasn't very crowded for lunch, very attentive service and the meats were very juicy and NOT overly bloody which I was happy about.  The salad bar was stocked with everything from basic caprese salad to a fancy steamed seafood pot.  I liked the cheese rolls and fried plantains as sides.  Plus for broccoli!  LOL. I like my veggies.

I am not a connoisseur of meats, but I think I had sirloin, turkey wrapped with bacon, sausage and skirt steak.   I didn't like the garlic beef which wasn't as tender as the test.   It was all tasty and the service was top-notch.  Everyone from the main host guy to the beverage servers were very polite and attentive.   It is a bit pricey if you order drinks and dessert, but my husband is a bbq fanatic and I let him have his day.  Overall, it was a good off-strip find, but make sure you are hungry so you can make the most of the price.

Dante was extremely professional and had a great sense of humor..Food was off the hook... Tri Tips were phenomenal ... Great part
 Of town

Really liked it! The meats were the best, delicious & tender! The lobster bisque was amazing! They have a waffle/egg bar, we had a waffle prepared while we waited, so warming and delicious! The best service ever, quick and friendly! Great Sunday Brunch for the price! We'll be back!

After multiple weeks of craving a churrascaria or..rodízio....we flip-flopped between Texas de, which was a twenty minute drive, with a birthday coupon for $25 off...and the five minute drive to Via....we made same-day resos on OpenTable at Via for 3 @ 7:15pm on Friday night. 
Hello beautiful unabashed protein fix!!
We were sat next to a wall and asked to be moved to a different table. They easily honored our request, even the Hostess helped us move our drinks to a center situated table. 
We all ordered the Sterling level. 
The cheesy rolls, pão de queijo ... ehh, I have certainly had much better. They were a bit too gummy and seriously under baked inside.
The salad bar, again...ehh. Much to be desired. As a ranch dressing fiend, it did taste housemade which was nice. But many items from the salad bar were overly and unnecessarily salty, imo. The beef carpaccio has two dabs of green olive puree, not sure why. I was told the lobster bisque was adequate, not great. 
Service -- really was very good. All of the servers, runners and the meat skewer guys were helpful, informative and stopped to check on us the entire evening in a not-so intrusive way. 
Looking at their menu posted online, we pretty much had every option at some point in the evening. Including leg of lamb -decent enough, baby lamb chops, sooo cute, but overcooked. Brazilian pork was moist if you asked not for the crispy part, melted mozz - all of the good parts of a pizza.
Sides were okay, mashed potatoes, asparagus, broccoli, mushrooms, fried bananas. The spinach was not completely wilted, perhaps that was a cost savings procedure? 
We all opted for dessert and espressos and cappuccino...passion fruit mousse - not my thing, but not terrible. Flan, no caramelized sugar sauce, but again not terrible. Chocolate mousse....slightly disappointing. It is one of my few dessert weaknesses...almost could not taste the pudding that was definitely whipped in.
In all, disappointed especially because of the proximity.
Brunch or happy hour seem to have better reviews, perhaps would have been a better visit. :-/

Holy crap, I hit 100 reviews on my last review and didn't even notice??  And I did my 100th reveiw on some sub-par establishment?  Shame on me!  To make up for it, my 101st review is on someplace stellar!

Via Brasil is on point!  Really a very good place to have a protein-filled dinner!  Calories?  Who cares!  With over 14 types of meat to choose from and a stocked salad bar with over 30 hot and cold items to choose from, you're gonna wanna get a taste of everything Via Brasil has to offer!

We started our meal with their warm Brazilian cheese buns which were gooey and tasty.  Our server also showed us that with each meal besides the all-you-can-eat salad bar and the meat, we also had unlimited choices of any of their side dishes that came from the kitchen.  I can't remember the entire sides menu but we ordered:

-Sweet potato fries
-Collard greens
-Fried bananas 

We placed our sides order in before we were escorted to the salad bar.  This was another treat.  It seems Via Brasil is on par with Texas de Brazil on salad bar selections, and there was many high quality items to choose from:

-Caesar salad 
-Grilled peppers
-Marinated portobello mushrooms
-Hearts of Palm
-Caprese salad (pretty good, creamy)
-Seafood salad
-Fine cheeses

Along with the salad bar are six hot dishes that are offered, on this day we tried:

-Mushroom risotto
-Fish in lemon butter sauce
-Rice & beans

All the salad bar items we sampled were fresh and pretty good.  I love a good salad with marinated fresh grilled veggies, brings on a sense of balance before you attack the meat like a t-rex!  Via Brasil's beans were super good, I loved the smoky flavor with the addition of the hamhock in the mix.  I had two bowls!  The only thing I missed from Via Brasil's salad bar versus Texas de Brazil's (and I should be ashamed in saying this) is that at Texas they have California Roll sushi on the line.  'Faux-shi'...for shame!  I dunno, I guess I just like having the option of eating it if I want to!

Shortly after we got our salads our side dishes arrived.  I enjoyed the tart of the collard greens, and both the sweet potato fries and fried bananas were good.  We finally flipped our little marker to green and off we were to the meat races!  We sampled just about everything on Via Brasil's menu that night:

-Garlic picanha
-Sausage
-Flank steak
-Tenderloin wrapped in Bacon
-Beef Ribs
-Prime Rib
-Leg of Lamb
-Salmon
-Chicken drumsticks
-Chicken hearts

Just about everything was excellent!  I noticed that Via Brasil uses a bit less salt than the folks at Texas which made the flavor of their meats a bit more appealing to my palette.  I loved the garlic picanha and their flank steak, juicy and tender.  The prime rib was great, just be sure to ask for a thicker cut!  The beef ribs were very good with their house BBQ sauce, I was eating part of a slab like Fred Flintstone!  The leg of lamb was not 'lamby' at all.  I had a small issue with the salmon, it was on the dry side.  But the surprise of the night was the chicken hearts, man were those good!  Reminds you of a Japanese izakaya because of that grilled flavor.  We almost ate an entire stake of these ourselves!  I am no stranger to exotic food!  Give it a shot and try it...you just might like it!

And don't forget to ask your server to bring their chimichurri sauce for your table!  It's a must for your meat!  The mix of olive oil, garlic, lemon, parsley and other herbs gives your meat that punch of flavor which will ignite your taste buds.  Super good!  

Via Brasil also does offer various dessert choices but after the meat attack we went through we were too full to order anything, I'm thinking maybe next time?  And yes, there will probably be a next time.

Service was very good here, our server was attentive, kept our glasses full, and answered any questions we had about the salad bar or the types of meat they served.  And don't forget to join Via Brasil's e-club!  You receive news on special events and promotions, as well as possible BOGO coupons on your birthday or anniversary!  Always a plus in my book to save that dough!

I missed the old Makino that used to be in this space, but Via Brasil has done a great job taking over.  We left happy with joyous memories, and our bellies full of food.  Food that alas, will force me to work twice as hard in the gym to burn these meaty calories off.  Uh...I work out!!

We stopped in on a Saturday night to sit outside and enjoy the perfect weather and to our surprise there was plenty of room. Ordering from the Happy Hour menu (5pm-8pm) we shared the Wedge Salad, Filet Mignon Sliders and side of fries. Everything was great -- the perfect amount of food (not too much!) and we were in an out quickly. Great job!

This was the best meal I have ever had. Between the food, service, environment, and management I had an exceptional experience. I will definitely be going back. The meats are grilled to perfection,  they came around frequently and there was a great variety. If you love Brasilian steakhouses this restaurant cannot be beat.

We come here all the time. You can't beat the food and the service. Ask for Fidel he is amazing, he is always there to get what ever you need.
I recommend everyone to come here and share in this experience
Great job!!! Atmosphere is excellent the meat .... AWESOME!!! I would definitely make this my restaurant of choice. If you love meat and plenty of yummy sides this is the spot!!

GREAT FOOD!!! Not so good for a person that doesn't eat much. The atmosphere is great especially for dinner. They had a live band and the waiters were attentive, polite, and were friendly. This was my first time eating at a Brazilian steakhouse, so i wanted to try every selection of meat and i was in for a treat!! They come by with the meat on the skewers and cut it right in front of you. :) I loved the beef ribs, it was cooked perfectly, so much flavor with every bite. The garlic steak was also another one i liked. There's also a salad bar. It was clean and FRESH. A good variety to chose from. The cold pasta was so delicious, i wished i can take some home with me! haha. If you can handle the dessert after dinner, go for it! From what i remembered, there were cheese cake, flan, pudding. I had their chocolate cheese cake and peanut butter and chocolate cheese cake. So GOOOOOD!!! It's pricey, but worth it!!!

My daughter held her wedding reception here last night with friends & family that traveled from California and Chicago and I was amazed with our dining experience. Anna helped my daughter arrange everything through emails & when we had our first in-person meeting the day before our event, everything was exactly the way we wanted it. We had a group of 30 people and every guest felt like they were the only one in the restaurant. The food was outstanding, fresh and presentation was impeccable. Clean plates were provided readily & without prompting, the open bar drinks were delicious...its extremely difficult to pinpoint favorites but several guests raved about the lobster bisque, prime rib, garlic steak, turkey wrapped with bacon, warm garlic & cheese bread, mozzarella served warm & gooey, flank steak....EVERYTHING was wonderful. I highly recommend Via Brasil for any & all of your dining needs.

Excellent atmosphere and food.  All you can eat of the best tasting meats in the universe. You must try this resturant, you won't be sorry. Start with the salad bar then, all the meats you can eat from steak to heavenly tasting chicken and so many o5her meqts you probably can't even think of.

Hands down the best all you can eat in Vegas. The salad bar is extensive but don't fill up there, the best is yet to come. The meat is excellently prepared and is carved at your table. There are 17 different kinds of meat, my favorites are the prime rib and flank steak. Great atmosphere, awesome service. Desserts and drinks are not included in the prixe fix. if you can still breathe after all the delicious meat, spring for dessert. I recommend the creme brulee or tiramisu.

Good place to take someone that can eat a ridiculous amount of food. The waiters hovered which was kind of annoying. Sangria was ok. They really pushed it and was a bit over priced. Otherwise the meats were good. Some kind of bland. Salad bar was nice but don't bother eating too much over there and wait for all those meats. Earlier the better. It gets a tad crazy there and you have to wait for the good stuff. You can request something on the list but dont hold your breath. They never did get back to us once it started getting busier so we just paid and left. Was an experience but just ok. Lamb chops were my favorite.

If I'm going to drop fifty dollars a head for dinner, I should absolutely be allowed to take my leftovers home. I paid for that food and it technically belonged to me. I just wanted to box up ONE plate. if I had known the Brazilian Steakhouse was cool with throwing away loads and loads of perfectly good food, I would've just ordered a bowl of lobster bisque.

Lobster bisque was good but could've been thicker, the bread rolls were ok, the top sirloin, turkey wrapped in bacon and sausage were my particular favorites but most of the meat was excellent. The side dishes were an absolute joke. We ordered fried bananas, the asparagus, the spinach and the rice side dish with the intention of sharing amongst the seven of us, which turned out to be impossible because they're single serving side dishes only. Restaurant was Pricy and ambient noise was loud enough to drown out companions waitstaff and others. 

Atmosphere was pleasant, the company was great so I did have an enjoyable time but I will not be returning, nor would I recommend via brazil
Great service. Delicious food. What more can you ask for? Definitely better than Texas De Brazil and Yolie's Brazillian Steakhouse.

We had a great Mother's Day brunch at Via Brasil Steakhouse today. What a GREAT assortment of meats, salads, omelettes & waffles. We tried a Bellini as well and it was delicious. Ask for Fidel, and you can't go wrong with the most excellent service. We've been there about five times and have never been disappointed. It's truly worth the price, especially if you use the "Loyal Blocks" app and get the $5 discount. We would certainly recommend it. It's a very special place to celebrate any occasion!!

I cannot put into words how amazing this place was. My husband and I were married at Always & Forever Wedding Chapel (review coming) and didn't have any desire to do an actual reception. I found this restaurant online and they were AMAZING. They arranged transportation for our entire party from the chapel to the restaurant, and back to the strip. We were in the private room and it was perfect. The staff was attentive, fun, energetic, and so polite. It was almost like I wasn't in Vegas anymore. For 89.99 a person we had unlimited meat....excellent, yummy, and a choice of 20 meats....and unlimited premium drinks for 2 hours. The food was phenomenal. The experience was fun for all our guests and everybody had a wonderful time...it was perfect. 
Anna, the event coordinator, was so great! She was there to greet our party, explain how the process works, and made sure every need was met. I can't recommend this restaurant enough...it was the perfect way for us to celebrate our wedding with all our family and friends.

If you are visitor to Vegas, without the car, this is not a good place to go. It's too far, Your meal is cost as much as the same your cab. it's really hard to get a cab to pickup after you want to return.  When we were there at that time, the waiter will go around us with the meat selection we really waiting for. We end up only taste about 7-8 kinds.  I had almost everything at other brasil steakhouse.

I love this place and it was great memory for my wife and me. We celebrated our wedding reception here with 30 other people or so. The staff was very supportive and encouraging to all of us. The food was delicious! I do think their buffet bar can add some more variety, but in a Brasil restaurant it's all about the different meats they send your way anyway. The best thing I took away from the experience was the excellent service and delicious food. I would recommend this place to anyone who's planning their wedding reception.

Amazing from beginning to end. 
Sat quickly. 
Never been to a Brazilian Steakhouse so was a little over whelmed at first but our waiter quickly noticed this and explained all the details clearly. 
Food was amazing. Can't beat the quantity and quality for the price. Service was EXCELLENT. especially enjoyed the opportunity to try things I might not usually try incase I don't like them but since its all exclusive why not try something out of your norm??!! Try the fried bananas!!!

We've had dinner here a few times and it's the best Brazilian restaurant in town. One of my favorite date night places. Ambiance is top-notch and the service is always 5 star. The food is delicious ---  flavorful and options are aplenty. The variety of foods at the salad bar is great. The best bread (the little balls with cheese inside) I've ever had. But, hands down, Via Brazil has the best happy hour menu, food and drinks, in town. Love this place!

This place is phenominal !! Be forewarned it is not cheap. The Rodizio buffet is like 44 bucks BUT it is an experience unlike any other. First and foremost the place is casual...saw people in t shirts and flip flops on a Friday nite. :) The "salad/appetizer" bar is a meal in itself and the place to start off. Be careful NOT to overeat at the salad bar because it is easy to do with the 25-30 items !! When you are ready to begin the main course, you simply turn over a coaster to "green" and the servers with skewers of 15 plus meats come by and you can say yes or no. When you want to be left alone, turn your coaster to "red" and they won't bug you. Look at staying around 2 hours and pace yourself !! Excellent choice for special occasions..

Excellent service, great food, beautiful restaurant. The waitstaff were incredibly friendly and professional. I felt like a queen. All the meat were soo good, I could not find anything to complain.  The fried bananas were so yummy and the flan dessert was to die for.  Definitely worth every penny!

At Via Brazil I like to describe my experience as tasty and classy!

At this extremely sophisticated Brazilian steakhouse you will find a wide variety of exotic cuts of meats, salads, drinks and desserts. At Via Brazil, you can be sure that you will be treated like a king, please keep in mind that my review is very accurate as I been polishing it throughout the years that I  have been going there. In addition, I would never be writing a review like this if I didn't truly believe that this restaurant is able to provide the experience that I'm describing here. This is hands down my favorite restaurant in Las Vegas, as you can see that I've been going there a lot.

Now, for you all that are questioning why is that Via Brazil have so many 5 star reviews, yet there are some random people out there that will rate it one star, please read with attention the following paragraph :)

As I have stated initially, Via Brazil is a classy, sophisticated, yet affordable Brazilian steakhouse. However, some people will try to take advantage of its "all you can eat" system, which allows you to pay a fee "per person" in order to take advantage of its rodizio. In Portuguese, we say "mas que coisa de pobre em?" Meaning that some people will try to take advantage of the system, by buying only one rodizio, while saying that his friends will "only be having drinks." Really? You come to a classy steakhouse with your girlfriend and friends and subject yourself to such situation, trying to share expansive meats with everyone in your table while paying for only one person? 

I think my message is clear here, this place is amazing, their foods and service are 5 stars, but sometimes business like this will get people trying to take advantage of their system. But they are a minority, as most people that go there are classy and educated people like you and me :)

Via Brazil is the best steakhouse in Las Vegas, period. They have the best happy hour in town, awarded many times for different magazines. In addition, I write because I feel like this is the right thing to do. Don't you think that if those people writing bad reviews really cared about creating a social media rating system that is truly accurate, they would at least be truthful in their statements? This is how we build an awesome Yelp community, by rating good place and helping bad places improve by writing reviews, taking pictures and being helpful! 

I write this because I love food, and Via Brazil is my favorite restaurant in the entire world. Luckily I work hard so that I can afford to pay for it and feed my wife, friends and family at Via Brazil when I wish too.

Finally, my tip for you who are new at Via Brazil follows:

- Start by eating some "SALGADINHOS" followed by a traditional "CAIPIRINHA"

- Second, eat some "PICANHA" and "FRAUDINHA"

- If you like sea food, they got you covered, their salad bar has the best "LOBSTER BISQUE" and steamed seafood. 

- If rodizio is just too much food for you, try their happy hour deals and I can guarantee to you that you won't be disappointed.

I hope you all enjoyed reading this review and please remember that if you are looking for a great night with great people and great food, then your night starts at Via Brazil Stakehouse! Remember to make reservations on special holidays like Valentine's Day because they do get really busy! Tell them you are going there because you read my review and maybe you get a free Caipirinha! I'm joking... but it's worth it a try ;)

Fine dining at it's best.  I just got back from an excellent meal from Via Brasil in summerlin.  I found myself comparing this place to Texas de Brazil in Town Square all night long.  And here is my verdict....The salad bar at Texas de Brazil is better, fresher, tastier.  However, the meats at Via Brasil are superior to Texas.  The meats are not as fatty and just taste better.  My favorites were the prime rib, top sirloin and beef ribs.  Both atmospheres are very nice, clean, and beautiful.  Another observation I made was that the staff at Via (the waiters, the guys that cut the meat, the managers, hostess) were much more professional, courteous and all around nicer than the staff at Texas.  I really liked this place.  I went on a groupon so I ended up paying $50 for 2 people.
So amazing! The service is amazing! Best place ever! I came for my birthday with my husband and parents and we will be back for sure!

We waited 30 minutes after our reservation time . Meat was just ok. Salad bar wasnt much of a salad bar ... Service was the worst I ever experienced . Felipe was the worst server I had.  He ditched us in the middle of us eating so we were confused on who was our server . We order dessert and never got it . I wouldn't waste my time going there .

Love this place! Surpasses Fogo de Chao and Texas de Brazil bar none! Food is always on point and the service is beyond expectations. Felipe,Fidel and Gerardo are always very accommodating and greet us with nothing but Joy! Defiantly a good go to place that never fails!

Caroline is the best! First time here. Came here for brunch and we might have over stayed our welcome but the staff never stopped being amazing. Ordered the bottomless drinks and was not disappointed. Great wine spritizers and mimosas. Our server Caroline was on top of filling our drinks and making sure we were happy the entire time, plus a wonderful accent. Will be back.

Came here two nights ago for NYE. I was able to make a last minute reservation that afternoon on open table. Had trouble finding parking in the lot directly in front of the building. It's a big shopping center so we parked on the other side. We came just a couple minutes before our reservation at 6:45 and the male manager rudely told us it would be a ten minute wait. Okay well I guess we will go to the bar. The bartender was very friendly and efficient. We waited closer to 20 minutes for our table. 
Out server Dante provided really good service as well as his two assistance. He had one guy who only seemed to do beverages and another one who picked up our plates and bring more side dishes. The sides were okay, a little under seasoned. The fried bananas were so good. They had the right amount of sweetness. There was constant stream of meat but it seemed be a lot of the same stuff. The sterling meal promises an upwards of 20 or more meats but I didn't feel like that was the case. The meat were well seasoned and delicious. The salad bar was okay, probably on the lower end of the spectrum. The salmon and chicken Marsala seemed to have been sitting there awhile. It was not very good. I wanted to try the flan but I was stuffed.

I love this place! I can eat healthy with the happy hour menu which is wonderful. The food is exceptional in the dining room. Great Quality for the price. I look forward to working in Summerlin. So I can eat here.
great restaurant. sat at the bar so didn't do the all you can eat. the food was slow, that's my only complaint. friendly staff. nice high ceiling restaurant. feel good ambiance

If you've never been to a churrascaria or Brazilian steakhouse, your first experience will likely be 5 stars simply from the wow factor of unlimited sumptuous meat being carved table-side and the opulence of a lavish salad bar that could serve as a meal in itself.  Pretty much everything I say onward will likely be inconsequential.  However, if you've been around the block a time or two as I have and want the tale of the tape between two local heavyweights (Texas de Brazil(TDB) vs. Via Brasil(VB)) going at it for twelve rounds, let's get it on!

Round 1 (Ambience) 
This may come down to personal preference since there is definitely an upscale vibe with soothing waterfalls and romantic lighting upon entering VB, but not sure if I liked the feng shui of the salad bar in the middle without any partitioning of the tables into separate little rooms for added intimacy.  TDB definitely has a more upbeat vibe with a casual bar area where you can await guests and separate little rooms although definitely more crowded and noisy since it is more bustling with turnover of guests.   Winner: Push

Round 2 (Cheese bread)
If you took the most perfect cheese puff and turned it into bread form, this is pretty much the pinnacle of that transformation.  TDB has a slightly cheesier flavor, which gives it a slight edge.  Winner: TDB

Round 3 (Salad bar)
For first-timers (or as I like to call them, churrascarookies), you never want to overfill your plate on the salad bar, as tempting as it may be.  However, it's good to wet one's appetite on some items to balance the meat fest to come.  I felt the overall quality was superior in the salad bar at TDB since they offered lobster bisque and focused more on artisanal cheeses and light seafood/veggies options, whereas at VB, there was one too many pasta options like cheese ravioli and other pasta salads, which are like underhanded tactics to fill you up to limit your meat intake.  Winner: TDB

Round 4 (Beverages)
VB took a knockdown in this round since the waiter sat us down and presented us with options for water(still or sparkling?) and upon choosing still, he charged us for two bottles of some premium water at 7 bucks/bottle without clueing us in about the option for tap water since we assumed it was complementary.  They also failed to carry Antarctica Guarana, the most popular soda in Brazil and something I look forward to anytime I venture into a Brazilian restaurant.  TDB would never allow the water fiasco to occur and always carry my non-alcoholic beverage of choice.   Winner: TDB

Round 5 (Opening meats)
Surprisingly, VB opens with a baked salmon served with passion fruit/mango sauce....not what I expected but really good, and the table-side presentation was a nice touch.  Usually at TDB, they start you off with some non-premium beef wrapped in thick bacon or some heavy pork/chicken option.  Winner: VB

Round 6 (Lamb)
Leg of lamb was sufficiently juicy and came with a nice mint jelly, but TDB offers multiple cuts including the lamb chop, which was unavailable at VB.  Winner: TDB

Round 7 (Fowl)
VB definitely had some interesting options including chicken, duck, and chicken hearts (upon request), whereas TDB only has a single dry chicken option which I tend to pass over to allow more room for other meat options.  The chicken and duck were very succulent and tender, and well seasoned here.  Winner: VB

Round 8 (Brazilian sausage)
Like the cheese bread, fairly standard and not being a huge sausage connoisseur, I'm not the best judge on this one.  Winner: Push 

Round 9 (Side dishes)
Taking an intermission from the meats, I think VB offers some additional Brazilian sides like fried/boiled yucca root and sauteed turnip greens which have a more stir-fried crispy preparation compared to the stewed version in soul-food.  Traditional favorites such as fried bananas and mashed potatoes are present at both.  Winner: VB

Round 10 (Beef)
Maybe it was the pace of the meats brought to our table, but I felt that the overall quality of the beef cuts were superior at TDB since there were a few cuts that were overly dry and tough at VB although certain cuts were very tender/flavorful.  WInner: TDB

Round 11 (Service)
Waitstaff definitely more attentive at TDB and the pace of the meat parade was more even, so I didn't feel like I had to overcrowd my plate and lose track of which meat was which.  The TDB meat carvers also wear a uniform that gives them some more professional flare, which I appreciated.  WInner: TDB

Round 12 (Value)
Somewhat tied into service, the server initially took our groupon voucher at the beginning but conveniently left it off in our final bill until we reminded him.  Taking account the variety/quality of meats/salad bar, would have to give slight edge to TDB.    Winner: TDB

By decision,winner of this fight goes to Texas de Brazil,but don't count out Via Brasil in a rematch.  A new fierce challenger has recently arrived into town(Fogo de Chao), so a TKO may be in our midst!

We went for dinner last Saturday on a Groupon, the food was amazing,  the mussels in the salad bar were some of the best I've ever had, so tasty! The service was phenomenal, it truly was an enjoyable dining experience, we'll be going back soon.

If I could do no stars, I would because we didn't even get a chance to eat here tonight. 

It's Valentine's day...I get that but if you take a reservation and call it a reservation, you should be in a position of managing your restaurant in such a way that your customers' tables are ready and available for them at the reserved time.  Especially if that time is a 9 pm reservation because according to Open Table at the time the "reservation" was made, it was the earliest time available for a party of 2. AND especially since Via Brasil called me to confirm the reservation yesterday afternoon. 

Upon arriving (15 min early, I might add) we discovered several other seemingly disgruntled couples standing outside of the restaurant. We walked in to check in for our 9 pm "reservation" and were told that "unfortunately" they were running behind and were only just seating people with 8 pm reservations meaning that our 9 pm reservation would actually be sat closer to 10 pm. 

So, the reservation wasn't really a reservation...it was call ahead seating booked through Open Table? For Valentine's dinner?  Riiiight. 

So, thank you Via Brasil...you actually did us a huge favor. Rather than waiting until nearly 10 pm to eat in your obnoxiously loud and crowded restaurant, we went across the street to Honey Salt and were sat right away.  We had an amazing meal for probably half the cost of what we would have paid at your restaurant. Funny thing about Honey Salt...they recognized the couples eat out at a nice restaurant for Valentine's Day and actually brought in extra tables to accommodate more patrons...GENIUS! Bonus points...they handed out roses to the ladies. Honey Salt is our new fave joint near our house. Separate 5 star review coming shortly for them...

Via Brasil is a carnivore's dream. Like other Brazilian steakhouses, you'll get plenty of cuts of meat from cows, chicken, lamb and more. I've driven by countless times but failed to visit until recently. Located at the corner of Charleston and Ft. Apache, the outside looks impressive, but the interior is even more so. It's large, open, and elegantly decorated.

If you want all-you-can-eat meat, there are two options. "Prime" is $39.99 and includes many basic items like garlic steak, BBQ baby back ribs, chicken breasts, drumsticks, flank steak, pork, and sausage. The higher end option is the "Sterling" for $49.99, which includes everything in the Prime option plus NY steak, lamb chops, leg of lamb, filet wrapped in bacon, salmon, and rib eye.

My favorites were the lamb chops, filet in bacon, grilled shrimp, trip-tip, and short ribs. 

For those that only want the salad bar, you can get that for $24.99. The salad bar has an impressive array of hot and cold dishes, although some turned out to be not so great. The beef carpaccio was under seasoned. Curry mussels were spicy and also felt gritty. The lobster bisque was creamy with rich flavors.

For dessert the creme brûlée was textbook perfect with a thick layer of sugar coating the top and creamy custard underneath.

It is a bit pricey (for two adults and one kid we spent well over $200), but if you're fond of Brazilian steakhouses, this one should be on your list.

My husband is a bit of a Brazilian Steakhouse freak as he lived in Brazil for some years. We have tried all of the major steakhouses multiple times including Texas and Fogo. We were a bit skeptical about trying Via after reading some of the Yelp reviews but it is definitely the BEST of all the ones we have been to. True it helps that my husband knows which meats are the best and which are more just filler meats but the sides and meat were both better than any of the other places. The salad bar was just okay but I never get too excited about that anyway as it is more of a distraction than anything from the real show, THE MEAT. Had such an enjoyable, delicious, authentic meal tonight and both agree that this will be our go to in Vegas. YUM.

My company hosted a dinner here last night and we were totally impressed and grateful to Anna! We had to organize the dinner in a little over a week for about 150 people and Anna did a fantastic job helping us out! The food was delicious the restaurant was awesome the customer service was right on... everything went perfect... Thank you Anna for everything you did from setting up the tables to making sure everyone was eating what they wanted... I really appreciate you and your staff!

Best Happy Hour in Las Vegas....In Summerlin at the corner of Ft. Apache and Charleston. 

Via Brasil offers good quality and provides great service. Have tried their Rodzilian dinner with beautiful salad bar and lovely meats, Sunday Brunch  (includes the same menu) and Happy Hour..  Beautiful room - more restful than the competition and very attentive service and friendly bartenders. . 

Happy Hour customers agree with me it's the best one in Las Vegas even with their recent price increases. .  Beer, wine, well drinks, mojitos and Capirinhas  range  from $4 - $6 dollars during HH.   HH Food is generally  small plates with some entree alternatiaves.   . Very large HH menu.  Some of my favorite dishes: Caesar Salad 4.50  (best in town and good portion) you can add chicken or steak to make it a meal.  Beef Carpaccio 6.50,  Asparagus Risotto  6.50 (large portion), They also have small portions of the steakhouse options which are yummy.  Restaurant has a lot of options for group events as well (Private dining room etc...)

This is a family run operation. The son and his wife manage this location and are always welcoming and friendly.  Friendly customers. This is my go to spot in Vegas.   Sign up for their email club and receive $25.00 off your first visit!

I usually hit Fogo de Chao when they hit me with 50% deals to my inbox and because of that, I truly forgot how good this place is.

Since I've hit every Brazilian place in town I'll point out the pros and cons of deciding on this place vs. heading elsewhere further down below...

THE OFFERING:
They give you two dinner options. One is $39.99 for 85% of the menu. The other is $49.99 and you get to add on unlimited rack of lamb, shrimp, filet mignon, table side cut ribeye, salmon, etc. Since it's main competition is Fogo de Chao and Texas de Brasil which are both $49.99, we all decided to do the premium dinner anyway and get the full experience (note, Pampas and Bertollucci in town are garbage. AVOID).

PROS:
-Excellent quality meat, very tender and flavorful. Better than Fogo and way better than that Pampas dump, about as good as Texas de Brasil (town square).
-Great service, they're friendly, you tell them what you want, they'll bring it cooked exactly how you like it, even if the entire table likes it's meat cooked differently.
-Beef carpaccio on the salad bar! -was very good and all you can eat. No other place has this.
-Lobster bisque on the bar was excellent, actually better than the bisque at sterling brunch.
-Grilled shrimp had a nice scampi flavor and they are generous with it as they come around.
-Fried, melted mozzarella with oregano, takes me back to the beach in Rio. Delicious and no other churrascaria in town offers this as well. It's good! A must try...
-The atmosphere is nice and the tables are well separated so you feel like you have your own space as opposed to some of the madness at Texas de Brasil. I like the smaller dining room feel and private space.
-The rack of lamb was large and meaty, bigger than most and cooked perfectly.

CONS:
-The pao de queso (cheese bread) wasn't totally hot and fresh and fluffy like I'm used to. My advice is to limit yourself on this addicting, cheesy ball of dough anyway, so not a big deal.
-The banana that I requested them to bring at the end of the meal desperately needed more brown sugar and perhaps a little caramel and a touch of cream. It wasn't sweet like the ones at Texas de Brasil.
-The accompanying sauces are hard to find and should have their own place on the salad bar to grab. I had to ask for mint jelly, the Brazilian style orange colored traditional steak sauce was no where to be found. There wasn't any horseradish (I forgot to ask) and the chimichurri sauce (which was on the salad bar) had next to it such a tiny, yet deep condiment dish that all the good stuff settled to the bottom and it seemed I was dipping the meat into oil rather than being able to dig into that good green stuff. Advice for next time would be to ask for all 4 sauces up front before the meat parade starts your way.
-Seldom do they offer discounts like Fogo de Chao and the occasional ones I find for Texas de Brazil.

OVERALL:
The quality of meat, the grilled shrimp, the lobster bisque, the beef carpaccio and the melted mozzarella are what puts this place towards the very top of the Brazilian steakhouse Vegas cluster. I was very pleased with the service and food and we all walked out a perfectly happy, bloated mess.

After hearing great reviews of this place, I was so excited to try it. Waited until the perfect night: Valentine's Day, to treat my special someone. I could not have been more disappointed. I made a reservation for 9 pm- arrived at 8:45 only to be waiting in a chaotic line for 30 minutes just to check in. Once I got to the front, the hostess informed me it would be (at least) an additional 45 minutes. I'm sorry, what is the point of a reservation if I will be seated OVER AN HOUR past my reservation time? I understand restaurants run behind at time, I've been in Food & Beverage for 9 years now and have experienced it all, but that amount of time is unacceptable. Ended up ruining the plans for our entire night. I wouldn't recommend this to anyone.
Come very very hungry! The food is great here, if it's your first time try everything.

What a waste of time. They were barely busy on the Tuesday evening my wife and I went, yet once seated with instructions on the salad bar and "table disc", it was down hill from there. The salad bar was not bad but some of the items (eggplant, mushrooms, and the hot chicken should have been changed out an hour before we arrived. All were dry and hard).  The meat they're famous for was either raw in the middle or, if we requested slightly more done was served very well done. Certain items must be requested. I asked for lamb chops. 4 times over 40 minutes before I was served 2 overdone chops. I asked twice for more bread. It never arrived. There were plenty of waiters around so there was no excuse for the lack of service. I have heard the Brasil Steak house at Town Center is better. I would never go to this one at Rampart and Charleston ever again. For $65 bucks a person with beverages and dessert, I can think of 2 dozen places I much rather go.

My husband and friends went here for a Sunday lunch (1:00pm) and by 3:30pm I was in a food coma and on our way home.  I walked into our house and walked straight into the bedroom (get your head out of the gutter!) where I had to take a nap until 8:00pm.  When I  woke up, I wondered "what the hell happened?"  Meat Feast is what happened.

Yes, that is a true story.  Yes, as someone referred to it below as a "food parade" is true.  Did I love it?  Absolutely.

We had a group of 8 people.  I did not know what to expect about going there.  But the waiter explained everything to us. They have a salad bar thing- salad, pasta, etc. so I went over there and got a few things.  

And then the meat came. 

 It started at a slow pace and quickly picked up to where I had like 10 pieces of meat on my plate, but didn't want to pass up the meat guy when he came to the table.  Eventually, I had to turn my thing over so they didn't offer me any more meat.   And it was damn good meat.  I say meat, because I had so many different types, its very hard to remember all of it.

We have some friends that are Asian and from Hawaii and they asked about chicken hearts.  Within 10 minutes, the meat guy came to our table with chicken hearts.  (not something I would ever try again)  But how accommodating!  

Everyone was really nice and willing to answer any questions!

Recommendation: wear stretchy pants- you'll need it.

It's been a year since I have been there... I think it might be time to go back!

I went with my family. They told us on the phone it would be $28 per person. We got there and it was buffet style, all u can eat salad, and various meats brought to your table and sliced onto your plate.  Appetizers were brought to our table also. The atmosphere and food is impressive and they've got 5 stars so far until I get the bill. They charged extra for desserts and drinks which it was assumed came with the buffet. $7 per dessert and about $3 per drink which made the bill about $30 more than expected. Those hidden costs were pretty underhanded because they even brought the dessert cart to the table and asked what we wanted for dessert. It would be just as unfair as finding out that the various poultry meats offered contained an extra charge.There were no menus and nobody told us drinks and desserts wouldn't be included in the buffet. I hope you scammers go out of business for pulling that crap.

Year after this, this place brings high quality and great service.  Amazing salad bar with a variety of veggies, cheeses, meats, soups, and entrees for you to eat in addition to the Brazilian style meat service.  The veggies are fresh and delicious and the area is always spotless.

I can't say enough good things about this place.  The food quality is excellent.  The meats are perfectly charred and seasoned and the server will cut you a portion depending on how cooked you like it.  

Sides are great too.  We always get mashed potatoes, broccoli, asparagus, and the plantains.  I'm surprised more people don't go.  The price is actually very reasonable for any restaurant let alone one that serves you so much meat (expensive) and has the level of service they do.  My favorite restaurant in the Peccole Ranch/Summerlin area.
Pass on this place, go to Texas de Brazil - 1000x's better.

Went to my cousin's wedding on Saturday,the manager was soo polite and helpful,she was doing everything in her power to make us feel special on my cousins special day! What a treat, everyone was super polite and service was fast and elegant, meats were hot off the fire and super delicious,don't know why all the bad reviews,they did a rocking job from start to finish,oo and the salad bar is gorgeous! Great job everyone,we will definitely be back to try the brunch.best night ever!!thank you

Spent $190 for my wife & I. Didn't feel bad about it because the food & selection is very good. 
I was not prepared for their method of serving the food but it was a good relief from the norm.

I don't care how hungry you are you will always surrender before they run out of food. Don't fill up on the salads and sides just let the meat keep coming and you keep eating. 

Save up and come hungry I think you'll enjoy it.

The service is good, the meat selection was not, they took forever to bring the meats to our table and when they did they offer us the following, prime rib, sausage, chicken, tri tip over and over and over  the same type of food.

Oh I also has a coupon from Yelp for a free dessert and the manager told me that they do not accept that coupon on holidays  but the coupon do not especify.

Oh on top of that the busboy  drop the dirty plates on oir feet..

OH....MY....GOSH..... sooooo AWESOME!
gal pals Susan and Justin went with me to eat at Via Brazil. We started by ordering a pitcher of PINEAPPLE SANGRIA. 
The glass was 9 bucks and the pitcher 23.00  didn't take a rocket scientist to figure out which one to order.  It was delicious, so tasty , remarkable white wine and fruit sangria that really went well with what was to come. 
Since I am a carnivore, and this is a carnivores dream- I have to say it was amazingly good. The salad bar had so many tasty items - I don't suggest filling up on these ... because the main attraction is the meat. 
and ohhhh the meat was soooo good. 
They start your meal with these little cheesy rolls .. they are like a hot chewy cheezit. YUM!
Then the salad bar... Parade of meat. 
Our server was completely awesome wish I could remember his name. 
We had a great time and even a fit of giggles from being so ECCLECTIC! 
Pricey so this is a once in awhile treat - but have to say it is worth every penny. I would go back just for the sangria... but the meal is so yummy I would HAVE to stick around for that too. 
Vicious Cycle. 
I suggest trying it ... eating is believing.
The food was excellent loved it the bacon wrapped filet was great

Took my bestie there for his birthday tonight and the service, the food and everything was great. Brandon was so helpful it made everything even better. The salmon, ohhhhh do not pass it up even if you are not a "fish person". So good! Oh and the beef flank is yummy. Lots of choices on the salad bar, they will just keep bringing you those sides and that meat- they don't mind if you need a break. Just flip your card over! We were there for over 2.5 hours and never felt rushed even when they got oobber busy! Great wine choices, even for the picky people!!! Go Go GO!!!

Zero Start if it's Possible.
Service and Food was Good, not a big deal, but one thing that make me do this Review was about how annoyed I was while eating.
The manager ( Ana ) was super annoying, we didn't have a chance to finish our salad and she was asking if we have any request for the meats.
All I wanted was to enjoy my wine and salad before starting the meats, but every 5 minutes she was on our table trying to get some request from us. Super pushy! Made me feel like she didn't want us to be there. She was annoying the other 4 tables next to mine with the same thing, asking REQUESTS. The Restaurant wasn't busy at all and one thing that I saw that grossed me out was, the same manager ( Ana ) made one of our meat servers clean the floor because he dropped some blood from the meat in the floor. Then she made him come back and serve us.
That for me was the end of the line! Health department should take a look at this. If she does this in the front of the house, can you imagine what goes on in the back? 
The good news is that FOGO DE CHAO will open a Restaurant in Summerlin really soon. Now locals will have the REAL Brazilian steakhouse experience & enjoy ourselves  like we deserve, for almost the se Price.

Amazing! The staff is friendly and very knowledgeable of their menu. They offered a great selection of perfectly cooked meats. Their salad and pasta bar is dangerously delicious... save room for the meats! They have an impressive wine list as well as a delectable choice of desserts. 

I recommend:
- sun dried tomato risotto
- salmon with passion fruit sauce (my favorite during the meal)
- garlic steak

Also... look at the cool picture of Pele on the bathroom door. ;-)
Favorite Brazilian steakhouse in Las Vegas, we take our guests from out of town all the time to Via Brasil. Happy hour drinks were delicious too.

My wife and I are locals, and this is our favorite restaurant in town. Food, service, and atmosphere are outstanding. Mary and I usually come in alone or with another couple. So when her brother called and said he was coming to Vegas with several clients for a golf weekend, where is a great restaurant "off Strip"? There was only one choice! First time bringing a large party in (10 people)....EXCELLENT 
As usual, Anna and her staff made it a wonderful experience! 
We can now add one more check to the list...
Great food
Great staff
Great atmosphere
Great dinner 
Great brunch
Great for couples
And now, Great for large parties

Very clean & neat -though dark & lacking life/atmosphere. 
The food was great w no complaints- it was funny to have garlic bread brought around as if it was meat.. Lol
I'm sorry but the atmosphere at Fogo De Chao wins.

Holy cow, every time i go it is remarkable. The meat is cooked perfectly and they make sure they bring you out everything to your specification....almost like you are the only ones there. Its Rodizio style- all you can eat perfectly cooked meat. Start with your salad bar and fine breads before the feast. If you havent experienced it, you need to ....stat.

We came here with a group of 50 people for a wedding rehearsal dinner.

For around $56 a person, we got the All You Can Eat salad/seafood bar, all you can eat meats brought to you (tri tip, sirloin, filet, bacon wrapped turkey, chicken, pork) side dishes (mashed potatoes, sautéed mushrooms, garlic bread, corn on the cob) and dessert.

The food was amazing and the service was outstanding. The servers come around consistently with different meats on a stick and accouterments and my plate was never empty. Who likes meat on a stick? This girl.

The only complaint I have is that they garnish everything at the salad bar with green onions. Every single dish, including the lobster bisque, is sprinkled with nasty green onions. Not everyone cares for the taste of raw onions, so maybe just put them on the side for people who want them? Garnishing dishes with green onions is lazy and unimaginative. Just sayin'.

We had a reservation for 2 at 6:30pm on a Saturday. The place wasn't crowded, so that was nice. 

The service here is Great.  Our waiter was very polite and attentive.  The servers came around with meat quite often...to the point where you're like omgosh I can't handle this meat madness anymore.

The food is Delicious.  There are lots of different meats to try (lamb, sirloin, steak, meat, meat, etc) and unlimited sides (broccoli, garlic bread, corn on the cob, etc etc) as well.  The meat is served to your liking; rare, medium, well done.  There is also a dessert cart with creme brule, chocolate cake, etc all ~$7.50.  They also have a drink cart that makes special Brazillian drinks.  The food bar has salad, rice and potatoes.

Overall, this place has good food and service.  Plan to leave here stuffed!
Great service and food! We had a groupon and this did not affect our service which I have found at times can! overall great experience!

Went for brunch...waffle station guy was so lack luster and with no personality.  They only have syrup you put on yourselves - you even have to ask for butter (geez).  They also offer omelets but that too I could have made better myself.  Salad bar was ok but no grilled eggplant and lobster bisque was like water.  It took forever to get our sides and cheese bread so I had to ask twice.  Meats were good but they shave off so little each time.  This was our 2nd time--I doubt we will return because it just isn't worth it.  I've tried Fogo de chao, pampas and Texas de brazil and TDB still wins because of the quality of meats and the better salad bar and lobster bisque.  Brunch was $24.99 and drinks are not included....

Just had my daughters 16th birthday party at Via Brazil and there is no way I can say enough here to show them how much we appreciate everything they did not only for us but all our guests.  First Anna was fantastic always on top of everything and anticipating everything we would need prior to our needing it.  The servers were absolutely amazing, it was a flawless dinner I was very impressed that they treated the 15-16 year olds there as adults and with respect.  They not only took care of 50 or so of us at dinner but also cut and served the cake for us.  Everyone from the kids to the adults were very impressed with everything you did and I would like to thank you for making her party the success it was.  I can't neglect to mention your hostess she was also amazing and we received many compliments how cheerful and helpful she was for our guests.  I have to apologize for not remembering your names, I was a little distracted that night.  We will always do our parties, get togethers or just dinner with you.   Thank you so much!

Valentines Day Dinner, Although we were seated on our reservation time, the wait for service was terrible. We were greeted and pretty much left alone after that. So we didn't have any drinks until we flagged the waiter 30 mins after we first sat.  The food was ok. Although we were there for quite some time, it was the same meat choices  (Brazilian sausage, Chicken Hearts, flank steaks) that came around.... Where was the Shrimp, Picanha, ribs, filet migon, NY strip, Prime Rib, Blackened fillet, other traditional Brazilian meats, etc? We accidentally spilled gravy  on the table and even though it was seen by some employees, they did not assist us.  We didn't even get a refill on drink unless we asked, and when we did, it would be at least 15 mins before we got the drinks. We were getting frustrated and so we just called it quits for the meats and ordered our desert, I actually timed it and it took 36 mins to get desert. With that's said, we went ahead and asked for our check as soon as we got our desert in hopes to get the check back sooner than later. We also noticed the table service was horrible, there was at least 3 to 4 tables that were empty for at least 30 mins or so. We started to wonder why they didnt clear the tables sooner as we saw the large crowd at the entrance waiting frustrated. In my opinion, I believe they had plenty of personnel working, I think the problem was with the leads or section managers not managing their folks.

It's been 4-5 years since I have been to Via Brasil and had no plans on coming back but my friend kept ranting and raving about how good it is,  so one day I was to lazy to go all the way to TDB so decides to give it one more shot.  I was disappointed again and paying nearly $50.00 was just not worth it. A few days later went to TDB and it was great as usual for the same price. The quality of the food and the ambiance is night and day. 

I have to say that I will definitely not be going to Via Brasil again!!!

Love this place!! My husband and I don't get to do date night often, but when we do we look for a quiet place, great service and exceptional food.   Via Brasil met all of that.  The food and service was impeccable and we left so stuffed because we tried a bit of everything and everything we tasted was fantastic!  We'll definitely be going back!

My siblings and I surprised our parents with a dinner reservation here for their birthdays, and they both had a wonderful time. Reserving a table was very easy, and we requested that the servers wish our parents happy birthday in the most "attention-arousing way possible." The waiters brought out platters with my parents' names written in chocolate, and trick candles that would not blow out. All of the staff were incredibly friendly, the food was incredible, and my parents both had an amazing experience.

The company at which I intern for occasionally hosts work dinners at Via Brasil, and we always have an incredible experience. I have been to Texas de Brazil many times, and while they are both viable options, I prefer the setting and location of Via Brazil slightly more. Via Brasil is typically less crowded and less expensive, and the food is equally incredibly as that of Texas de Brazil.

Altogether, Via Brasil is a perfect option for dinner any day of the week, and the staff are always very friendly and willing to accommodate any special needs/requests. One specific waiter even remembered my meat preferences during my dinner, and offered me "well-done" portions of each of the meats. Via Brasil is highly recommended by me, my family, and the company at which I work.

Salad bar was little to be desired. They bring the cheapest cuts of meat. I asked for shrimp for over an hour and they finally tried to bring me two shrimp, ha! They were tasty but come on two grilled shrimp? The filet mignon was wrapped in limp bacon and the size of a fifty cent piece. They are not worth my time, Texas De Brazil spins circles around this place. Never again.

I decided not to make firm plans for my boyfriends Bday dinner because I wasnt sure if he would be back in town. We had no problem getting a last minute table here on a Sat night. The staff was all very nice and helped to make the evening a success. 

The Salad Bar: 2 stars... Not super fresh. I normally love lobster bisque but this tasted condensed. 
The bread: Very good! 
Meat selection. I certainly didnt see 18 choices... The ribs were AMAZING!! I was happy I could have rare and it was all cooked perfectly. 
Sides: Cooked to order. Asparagus was a little undercooked. 
Dessert: Awesome! You must try the Truffles. 
Wine: Decent selection
Surroundings: Def not a "romantic" vibe... I wouldnt take a date here. 
Service: 10000 stars :)

What it is missing... Something to make it "special". Sauces for the meats would be nice as well. I had to have A-1 for the first time since I moved to Vegas because they have no house sauces. Overall, I probably wouldn't go back unless I had a coupon or I was invited there. It was good but it didnt blow me away.

The service is top notch and that alone will make me want to come back and eat here again. The food quality is delicious! All the meat selections were so delicious. If you love meat and all you can eat then this the perfect place for you.

About 1 or twice a month my family and i come here and i do have to say that the restaurant staff from the hostesses to the waiters all the way back to the chefs are very professional and have very great cutomer service, every time we come here we get the Cheers treatment where everyone knows us by name and the food is ALWAYS top notch and if at anytime we want something specials cooked they have no problem doing so. Thank you all at Via Brasil Steakhouse for being great.

Went there for the first time last week with my nephew, husband and son. When we are craving Brazilian Steak Houses, we would always go to Texas de Brazil at Town Sq. But we had a certificate so figured we try it out....when calling to make the reservation, the hostess joined us up for their email club, and when she asked for my birthdate and saw my birthday was the week before, told me we would get my meal comped due to it being my birthday month. Or If your a first time customer, you receive 20% of your whole bill.

Food was delicious and their prime rib was the best I or my family, have ever had!!!

And the service, was amazing and rivaled any 5 star restaurant!!!

Definitely give this place a try! You won't be disappointed.

Service was wonderful! Fidel, Anna, and Ashley were incredibly kind and accommodating. We loved the filet mignon sliders and asparagus risotto. The cocktails were good too- but a little on the sweet side. If you're into sweet cocktails, try the x-rated or passion fruit caipirinha, or the strawberry kiwi sangria. If you want a less sweet cocktail, try the lime caipirinha. My fav cocktail was the fortified sangria (it's spiked with brandy and rum)...mmmm

Good Summerlin location. They have a good happy hour with drinks ranging from $4-7 and it's every day of the week. Compared to other Brazilian steakhouses (like Fogo de Chao), this was very good. Wasn't too busy on a Sunday evening, so the waiters were attentive. The Top Sirloin and Prime Rib are the BEST offerings on their menu. Salad bar was pretty decent. And, since we were celebrating a friend's birthday, they threw in a free small dessert.

Amazing food!!! Highly recommend, my favorite meat  is the House Sirloin, I went with my friend and we have had a great dinner. A pleasant place and nice friendly service.  Can wait to come back!! The best  steakhouse in Las Vegas!!!

Very pleased with our experience. It was our anniversary and 2 birthdays to celebrate. The salad bar and unlimited sides were great. The 21 meats were moist and wonderfully prepared. The staff came round every couple of minutes, service was exceptional. Our complimentary champagne and desserts were appreciated as well. 

I definitely recommend this restaurant to all.

Ugh, Valentine's Day service! So many reasons to HATE this place. Here's why: 

Arrived in time for our dinner reservation at 9pm, only to be lied to constantly about the wait time. Wait time? With a reservation??? Apparently so. We hung out at the bar with a lot if other angry people with delayed reservations. Management came and went, never really providing much of an update and obviously had little concern for what was going on. We heard cuss words. Not very professional at all. 

Since we were seated about an hour late, the salad bar was beyond picked over. There wasn't much left and it was messy. 

The side dishes were skimpy. The spinach was salty. Other sides were ok but very small. 

The meat servers never seemed to make it to our table. They circled through the tables on the same pattern, and always ran out of meat just before our table. Awesome. In an hour, we had only been served meat three times. Wow. 

I checked in on Yelp, which offered a free dessert, only to be told that they would NOT honor the free check in coupon because it was a "holiday". Well....THEN WHY DO you HAVE a check in coupon?!?! The dessert we did have was disappointing (watery Tiramisu). 

We have been to all the Brazilian style steakhouses in Vegas, and loved it. Viva does NOT do Brazilian steakhouses justice. In fact, the poor service and bad food make the other steakhouses more appealing. Viva makes McDonalds look appealing. 

I can honestly say that we will NEVER be back and we will tell all our friends, family and coworkers about our horrible experience here. Cannot believe this restaurant will be in business much longer treating customers like this. HORRIBLE.

I wasn't realy impressed. Their better tasting ones in my opinion was the leg of lamb and the chicken.  Sirloin, rib-eye, flank were okay. Texas de Brasil might be more saltier with their meats compared to this place or you can say this place had less flavioring on their meats. Their salad bar was small, and didn't have much varieties like Texas de Brasil. This place has nice decor and pretty upscale. Overall conclusions: Texas de Brasil is better.
This place is one of my fav's so far. The staff are always attending you to make sure you have what you need. Their meat is delicious and their drinks are even better.
Very disappointed.  Unprofessional.  Overpriced.  This place is a ripoff.  Lack of customer follow-up.  This business won't last.

After posting my previous review about my 1-star experience on New Year's Eve, I was contacted by an employee offering to have me back for another meal and to refund my poor experience. I happily accepted, as I'm open to giving people more than just one shot.

Unfortunately, they messages they sent me were deleted (not by me...) and my attempts to contact them directly at the email address provided in the message have gone ignored.

Not only was my experience with their restaurant very poor, my experience with their customer service after the fact has been extremely disappointing as well. I can not stress enough how poorly I rate this establishment.

Love this place! So yummy! Took my whole family for my guys birthday and they were all so attentive!plan to be stuffed! Only complaint is they frequently bring by the cheaper meat as I wanted more of the filet!oh and they charged my son full price ..I didn't realize till I. Got home..he's 11 and ate well so I wasn't too upset! But they gave my guy a special birthday  dessert that he loved.so all in all we all enjoyed it !
Food is cooked perfect, service is fast and courtious, very clean and classy, great dining experience

Everything about this place is amazing! Went tonight for my Hubby's bday. Everyone is so friendly and the food, OMG, SO GOOD!  I ate entirely too much, so much I don't think I'll need to eat tomorrow. Anyways, they sang to my hubby  and brought him flan with a candle. This place is SO WORTH  the money.  We will be back!!

The beginning was great, then it went down hill.   Was told there were 18 types of meat, while we only got offered 8 types.  Never saw the other 10 missing types of meat.  We spent over $110 for two people on dinner and never got dessert or a coffee, everything is a la carte, (extra). I made a point to call them before I bought my two groupon coupons, but after we ate there the bill was an additional $35 on top of what I paid online.
Im disappointed we did not get to try the dessert & coffee.  No filet mignon, or veal was offered, where was the missing 10 meat types.???

I brought my uncle here for dinner last night and we had an enjoyable dinner.  I have eaten here a few times now and this is one of my favorite restaurants in Summerlin.  The first time I dined here was the best, but each time after has been consistently great as well.  I LOVE their friend bananas!!!  I was a little disappointed last night they did not have the risotto out on the table, but I found plenty of other options to try.  I enjoyed coming for brunch the best as they seemed to have different meat choices and the price is a lot lower.  The pineapple was very good they had during brunch.  I always end my meal with one of their cappuccinos.  The service is always fast and you never go without a full glass of water.  I hope to try their happy hour soon!  Can't wait to come back again.

I went in there for dinner while I was getting my hair done at the salon next door. I had an ODORLESS black dye on my hair (no bleach) that needed an hour to process and I was hungry, so tried to kill 2 birds with one stone. I sat at the bar cause it was more causal but apparently my hair dye was offensive as the owner exiled us to the back of the restaurant behind a fountain next to the sliding doors that had a crack with all the cold air coming in. We were freezing and humiliated. Are they even legally allowed to do that?! I went and apologized to the other people at the bar for bothering them assuming someone complained, but they said they didn't notice or care that I had dye in my hair. So, it was definitely the call of the venue alone. Rude! Needless to say, I won't be going back. At least the bartender was nice about it. She was so embarrassed for us and trying to make up for  it she made me a free drink!

Horrible start to our New Years Eve 2014. Took nearly 50 minutes to get seated after our reservation time. We finally had to point out a table that had been sitting empty for over 20 mins to the host team. One of the main hostesses just rolled her eyes at the other hostess for not seeing it. We were finally seated at 11:10pm. We watched as one other lonely couple also waited as long as us because the hostess gave away their reservation. We witnessed "cousins of a waiter" (a party of over 15 people) getting sat without a reservation long before us. We gazed at three empty tables in the bar- which would've suited us fine- but nobody was smart enough to come up with an easy solution. All we really wanted to do was sit down and eat and enjoy time with our friends that were visiting. Where was management in all of this? I started to feel sorry for the staff, all of whom seemed entirely overwhelmed and tossed to the wolves.
A staff member told us that the Manager was too busy waiting on tables and leaving other waiters high and dry with very few tables on this incredibly busy evening. A manager never checked in with us at all the entire night, even after we expressed our dissatisfaction to our server- Girardo. He did the best he could and was pleasant enough. 
The food was okay but the $80 fixed price NYE meal was a big joke, and I would not recommend it to others. The sides were pathetic. The top sirloin was very good. The whole experience was rushed, which was unfortunate as we were trying to spend a nice evening out with out-of-town guests. We had to rush and get everything we wanted from the salad bar before they took it all away right before midnight and changed to desserts. One of my friend's is a vegetarian, so she was counting on another trip up but before we knew it it had been whisked away.
Very hard to justify a $360 bill for four people after the bad start to our dining experience. Over half the restaurant brought their children and they were all running wild all night long. I understand that some families want to be together on NYE, but would you let them go crazy like that on a normal visit to Via Brasil? The music was entirely too loud, we couldn't hear each other at the table. All in all, we couldn't wait to get out of this place and never come back. Definitely leaving Via Brasil in 2013. We won't be back- EVER.

Went for happy hour and to try a new place. When I got the bill that was almost $80 I was very upset to say the least. We were not told of a special set of food and drinks being discounted and were charged excessive prices for the tiny portions we did order. Don't bother with this place, just out for your money. Should be closer to the strip if they want to do business that way.

Terrible! My wife and I ate here after a crossfit competition. We were starving and in need of some protein. We chose to give this place a try as we've tried several other Brazilian steakhouse throughout the valley. 

The salad bar was horrible. The selection was small and they were removing hot foods as they were checking the temp of the water and the burners/warmers weren't working. I appreciate the fact they removed the food that wasn't being kept warm...it just further reduced the already minimal selection. 

The meats weren't well seasoned, sides of yucca and fried bananas were underwhelming. I ordered black beans and rice but my waitress never brought it out. I didn't even remind her as my wife and I didn't want to risk yet another poor tasting dish at that point. 

The only good tasting food was the sautéed shrimp. Save your money and go to Texas de Brazil or anywhere but here.

There were so many types of meat to choose from as the servers walked around that I lost track of which ones I liked. The food was quick to fill me up. There were a couple of steak choices that I really loved. The staff is really friendly and patient too.

A nice place for a date or anniversary. I wouldn't come here as much because of the price, but it's well worth it when I do.

My brother and I went there a while ago and I have to say this to everyone.....
Avoid Via Brasil Steakhouse. The staff was BEYOND rude and I will never step foot in there again. Bottom line was that I was accused of skipping out on a bill that wasn't mine and they just plain Embarrassed me. I asked to talk to the Manager and I have yet to hear from anyone. I will not apologize for yelping nor will I remove this. The Via Brasil Steakhouse NEEDS to own up for their actions. I have NEVER stolen in my life and I have never been accused of it either ......until I went to Via Brasil. You lost a customer forever.

What a huge Disappointment!!! From the start the service was horrible ... Had a reservation for 2:30 and showed up 45 minutes early and went to the bar !! The bartender was overwhelmed and we waited 15 minutes before I went to the bar and then was ignored for about 10 minutes ! 

During this time my wife had gone to the hostess and mentioned how long it is taking to get service and the hostess had the nerve to say you are upset over a drink ?? My wife said well yeah... We have a reservation and its Mothers Day  and we are sitting in the bar !! She then asked to speak to the manager and I watched the hostess approach the manager and tell him that a lady was complaining about the service in the bar .... Now let me paint a picture of what was going on in the bar at this time ! There were a total of 5 people sitting in the bar including the three of us and none of us were being waited on . It was the change between Brunch and dinner and there were three people behind the bar !! The manager , bartender and a young lady punching stuff in the computer !! At the drink station where the servers would pick up had 6 people waiting for their drinks for their tables !! 

Now back to the manager !! He completely ignored the situation for about ten minutes literally walking past us and in circles for about another two minutes until he finally asked if we are ok ?? At this time we decided we would leave and gave the feedback that they were clearly not staffed for Mother's Day and he had no idea what he was doing and the staff was very rude !! We will not be going back and Texas De Brazil will have our Business forever !! 

Completely frustrating and upset !!

Very saddened by the fact that we had reservations for New Year's Eve and no one told us it was going to be double (yes double $80) for rodizio dinner till we were sat down at our table after we had time to order a drink from the bar. We made our reservations a week in advance and even at that time were we not informed of the price change. When we asked to speak to the manager, she walked toward our table then walked the opposite direction. Needless to say, completely unimpressed with the lack of communication on price change, as well as what was done to try and help the situation.

So we came here for my  nephews birthday and we found it on yelp. Not being from Nevada we had no idea it was way off the strip. So glad we found this spot. I've been to other Brazilian joints and it's been good but the staff setting and the salad bar were above the others. 
A great selection of wines are displayed front and center. I don't have a great knowledge of wines but it was from the ceiling to the floor.
We had a fantastic table just in front of the chefs skewering all the fresh cuts. And Fidel being well knowledgeable made many suggestions and took care of our 17 person party. Some of our party was getting missed on meats and within two minutes they had a selection of all the fine meats. Great night. Bathrooms clean everything clean and this is the spot if you want to feel local and exotic. Great job guys!!!!

I've been to a few Brazilian steakhouses now this place has the best meat in Vegas.  The salmon was cooked very well and it was a nice surprise to see it on the menu.  They also had some chicken hearts that were great.  The lamb was juicy tender and cooked to medium rare just how I like it thinking about that that is how all the meat is perfect in my mind much more flavorful than texas de brazil.
